ipMRouteEnable.name: ipMRouteEnable
ipMRouteEnable.description: The enabled status of IP Multicast routing on this router.

ipMRouteTable.name: ipMRouteTable
ipMRouteTable.description: The (conceptual) table containg multicast routing information for IP datagrams sent by particular sources to the IP multicast groups known to this router.

ipMRouteEntry.name: ipMRouteEntry
ipMRouteEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) containing the multicast routing information for IP datagrams from a particular source and addressed to a particular IP multicast group address.

ipMRouteGroup.name: ipMRouteGroup
ipMRouteGroup.description: The IP multicast group address for which this entry contains multicast routing information.

ipMRouteSource.name: ipMRouteSource
ipMRouteSource.description: The source network address for which this entry contains multicast routing information.

ipMRouteSourceMask.name: ipMRouteSourceMask
ipMRouteSourceMask.description: The network mask of the source address for which this entry contains multicast routing information.

ipMRouteRpfNeighbor.name: ipMRouteRpfNeighbor
ipMRouteRpfNeighbor.description: The address of the RPF neighbor from which IP datagrams from this source to this multicast address are received.

ipMRouteInIfIndex.name: ipMRouteInIfIndex
ipMRouteInIfIndex.description: The value of ifIndex for the interface on which IP datagrams sent by this source to this multicast address are received.

ipMRouteOutList.name: ipMRouteOutList
ipMRouteOutList.description: The value of ipMRouteNextHopList which identifies the list of entries in the ipMRouteNextHopTable representing outgoing interfaces to which IP datagrams from this source to this multicast group address are forwarded.

ipMRouteUpTime.name: ipMRouteUpTime
ipMRouteUpTime.description: The time since the multicast routing information represented by this entry was learned by the router.

ipMRouteExpiryTime.name: ipMRouteExpiryTime
ipMRouteExpiryTime.description: The minimum amount of time remaining before this entry will be aged out.

ipMRoutePkts.name: ipMRoutePkts
ipMRoutePkts.description: The number of packets which this router has received from this source and addressed to this multicast group address.

ipMRouteRpfFails.name: ipMRouteRpfFails
ipMRouteRpfFails.description: The number of packets which this router has received from this source and addressed to this multicast group address, which were not received from the interface indicated by ipMRouteInIfIndex.

ipMRouteOctets.name: ipMRouteOctets
ipMRouteOctets.description: The number of octets contained in IP datagrams which were received from this source and addressed to this multicast group address, and which were forwarded by this router.

ipMRouteNextHopState.name: ipMRouteNextHopState
ipMRouteNextHopState.description: An indication of whether the outgoing interface and next hop represented by this entry is currently being used to forward IP datagrams. The value 'forwarding' indicates it is currently being used; the value 'pruned' indicates it is not.

ipMRouteInterfaceTable.name: ipMRouteInterfaceTable
ipMRouteInterfaceTable.description: The (conceptual) table containg multicast routing information specific to interfaces.

ipMRouteInterfaceEntry.name: ipMRouteInterfaceEntry
ipMRouteInterfaceEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) containing the multicast routing information for a particular interface.

ipMRouteInterfaceIfIndex.name: ipMRouteInterfaceIfIndex
ipMRouteInterfaceIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of the interface for which this entry contains information.

ipMRouteInterfaceTtl.name: ipMRouteInterfaceTtl
ipMRouteInterfaceTtl.description: The datagram TTL threshold for the interface. Any IP multicast datagrams with a TTL less than this threshold will not be forwarded out the interface. The default value of 0 means all multicast packets are forwarded out interface.

igmpInterfaceTable.name: igmpInterfaceTable
igmpInterfaceTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the interfaces on which IGMP is enabled.

igmpInterfaceEntry.name: igmpInterfaceEntry
igmpInterfaceEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) representing an interface on which IGMP is enabled.

igmpInterfaceIfIndex.name: igmpInterfaceIfIndex
igmpInterfaceIfIndex.description: The interface for which IGMP is enabled.

igmpInterfaceQueryInterval.name: igmpInterfaceQueryInterval
igmpInterfaceQueryInterval.description: The frequency at which IGMP Host-Query packets are transmitted on this interface.

igmpInterfaceStatus.name: igmpInterfaceStatus
igmpInterfaceStatus.description: The activation of a row enables IGMP on the interface. The destruction of a row disables IGMP on the interface.

igmpCacheTable.name: igmpCacheTable
igmpCacheTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the IP multicast groups for which there are members on a particular interface.

igmpCacheEntry.name: igmpCacheEntry
igmpCacheEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the igmpCacheTable.

igmpCacheAddress.name: igmpCacheAddress
igmpCacheAddress.description: The IP multicast group address for which this entry contains information.

igmpCacheIfIndex.name: igmpCacheIfIndex
igmpCacheIfIndex.description: The interface for which this entry contains information for an IP multicast group address.

igmpCacheSelf.name: igmpCacheSelf
igmpCacheSelf.description: An indication of whether the local system is a member of this group address on this interface.

igmpCacheLastReporter.name: igmpCacheLastReporter
igmpCacheLastReporter.description: The IP address of the source of the last membership report received for this IP Multicast group address on this interface. If no membership report has been received, this object has the value 0.0.0.0.

igmpCacheUpTime.name: igmpCacheUpTime
igmpCacheUpTime.description: The time since the system joined this group address, or zero if the system is not currently a member.

igmpCacheExpiryTime.name: igmpCacheExpiryTime
igmpCacheExpiryTime.description: The minimum amount of time remaining before this entry will be aged out.

sysID.name: sysID
sysID.description: An integer which serves to identify the type of ES/1.

sysReset.name: sysReset
sysReset.description: The time, in centiseconds, before the ES/1 should reboot. A GetResponse value of zero indicates that no reboot time has been specified.

sysTrapAck.name: sysTrapAck
sysTrapAck.description: Whether the NMS will acknowledge the enterprise specific traps.

sysTrapTime.name: sysTrapTime
sysTrapTime.description: The time, in centiseconds, which should expire between the sending of traps. This value is used when no ICMP source quench datagrams have been received. The ES/1 uses sysTrapTime if any SNMP requests from the NMS has been received within the previous sixty seconds. If no requests have been received, then the ES/1 reverts to its default of a fifteen second wait between the sending of traps.

sysTrapRetry.name: sysTrapRetry
sysTrapRetry.description: The time, in centiseconds, which should expire before an unacknowledged Trap is re-transmitted.

sysTrapPort.name: sysTrapPort
sysTrapPort.description: Zero, or the UDP port number to which a second copy of SNMP traps should be sent. Valid values are zero through 65535.

hwNumber.name: hwNumber
hwNumber.description: The number of slots available for hardware modules, regardless of whether or not the slots are currently populated. This number is fixed as 7.

hwSlotTable.name: hwSlotTable
hwSlotTable.description: A list of the most recent occupants of the slots; one per slot.

hwEntry.name: hwEntry
hwEntry.description: A set of objects for each slot.

hwIndex.name: hwIndex
hwIndex.description: The slot number, beginning with 1 for the top-most slot. This number always matches the instance of the hwEntry. For example, {hwIndex 3} contains the value '3'.

hwType.name: hwType
hwType.description: The module type of the slot's most recent occupant since the ES/1 was started. The values for hwType correspond to the values for hwPortType.

hwUseMod.name: hwUseMod
hwUseMod.description: Whether to use this module, not applicable for the Packet Processing Engine. The value of hwUseMod is not saved if the ES/1 reboots. If the module fails diagnostics, it will not be used, regardless of hwUseMod.

hwDefType.name: hwDefType
hwDefType.description: The module type defined for the slot. Certain pre-defined relationships exist. Slot 1 always contains the Packet Processing Engine board. Slots 2-6 are either unoccupied, or contain IOM boards. Slot 7 is either unoccupied or contains the Turbo processor board. If hwDefType does not match hwType, then the module will not be used, regardless of the value of hwUseMod. Note that hwDefType can only be changed by rebooting the ES/1.

hwDiagStatus.name: hwDiagStatus
hwDiagStatus.description: Results of diagnostics, when diagnostics were last performed on the module (whenever a module is released from reset, which is usually at power-up).

hwInuse.name: hwInuse
hwInuse.description: Whether the module is currently executing its operational software.

hwDiagCode.name: hwDiagCode
hwDiagCode.description: Additional diagnostics information concerning the slot's module. The meaning of hwDiagCode depends upon the slot's module type described by the hwType parameter. For the Packet Processing Engine board, any error (except where noted otherwise) will prevent the ES/1 from booting. For the Turbo processor board, FDDI IOM board (FIOM), the intelligent FDDI IOM board (IFIOM), the Ethernet/802.3 IOM boards, the Token-Ring/802.5 IOM boards, the HSSI IOM board, any error will prevent the board from being used.

hwManufData.name: hwManufData
hwManufData.description: This is a 24 byte array which contains the part number, serial number and hardware revision level of this module. The Turbo's hwManufData will be all blanks since it is manufactured as part of the Packet Processing Engine module.

hwPortType.name: hwPortType
hwPortType.description: This is a variable-length byte array, where each element represents the port types belonging to this module. The Packet Processing Engine's ports are fixed as 'uart' for the first port, and 'none' for any other ports. The Turbo's ports are fixed as 'none' for all ports. The following port types are supported: none (0) there is no port csma (1) Ethernet or 802.3 port fddi-das (2) FDDI DAS port fddi-sas (3) FDDI SAS port tpr (4) Token Passing Ring port wan (5) Wide Area Network port uart (6) UART port

hwPortStatus.name: hwPortStatus
hwPortStatus.description: This is a variable-length byte array, where each element represents the status of the port belonging to this module. Values of 01 (status-good) or hex ff (status-bad) are supported. For the Packet Processing Engine, the first byte is the status of the UART port.

hwDefPortType.name: hwDefPortType
hwDefPortType.description: This is a variable-length byte array, where each element represents the port types defined for the module. If hwDefPortType does not match hwPortType, then the port will not be used. Note that hwDefPortType can only be changed by rebooting the ES/1.

hwAddr1.name: hwAddr1
hwAddr1.description: The unique hard-wired 48 bit MAC address for the module's 1st port. For the Packet Processing Engine, it's a unique MAC address to be used as part of the ES/1's Spanning Tree Bridge Identifier. For the Turbo, not applicable.

hwAddr2.name: hwAddr2
hwAddr2.description: The unique hard-wired 48 bit MAC address for the module's 2nd port, only applicable for IOMs.

hwAddr3.name: hwAddr3
hwAddr3.description: The unique hard-wired 48 bit MAC address for the module's 3rd port, only applicable for IOMs.

hwAddr4.name: hwAddr4
hwAddr4.description: The unique hard-wired 48 bit MAC address for the module's 4th port, only applicable for IOMs.

hwTempOK.name: hwTempOK
hwTempOK.description: The temperature condition of the module, where True indicates temperature okay, and False indicates temperature too hot.

hwFirstPort.name: hwFirstPort
hwFirstPort.description: The ifIndex number of the first port which resides within this module. [Not applicable for the Turbo.]

hwFatalErr.name: hwFatalErr
hwFatalErr.description: This is a 32 byte array which contains information about the cause of the module's last unexpected self-reset, since the ES/1 booted.For the Packet Processing Engine and Turbo, this will always be all zeroes, since failure of such a module will cause the ES/1 to reboot. For the other modules, this field either contains all zeroes (if the module has not self-reset), or it contains values according to the format of configFatalErr, with a first byte of either 'Watchdog Timeout' (1) or 'Fatal Error' (3).

hwRptrPorts.name: hwRptrPorts
hwRptrPorts.description: This is a variable-length byte array, where each element represents the repeater capability of the port belonging to this module. The element value is zero if the port is not present or does not have any repeater capability; otherwise, the element value indicates the number of repeater ports at that port.

hwPortSubType.name: hwPortSubType
hwPortSubType.description: This is a variable-length byte array, where each element represents additional port type information.

swNumber.name: swNumber
swNumber.description: The number of file sets. This number is fixed as 2.

swFilesetTable.name: swFilesetTable
swFilesetTable.description: A list of the software file sets stored in the ES/1. The first file set refers to the file set that was used when the ES/1 last booted. The second file set refers to the file set that will be used when the ES/1 reboots or reloads any hardware module.

swFileset.name: swFileset
swFileset.description: A set of objects for each file set.

swIndex.name: swIndex
swIndex.description: The file set number, beginning with 1 for the first file set. This number always matches the instance of the swFiles. For example, {swIndex 2} contains the value '2'.

swDesc.name: swDesc
swDesc.description: The description (0-255 bytes) of the software file set.

swCount.name: swCount
swCount.description: The number of files in the file set. This number may range from 1 to 255.

swTypes.name: swTypes
swTypes.description: The types of the files within the file set.The size of swFileTypes may be determined by swCount. The possible file types are none (0) File not present ppe-turbo (1) Packet Processing Engine and/or Turbo Code ppe-only(2) Packet Processing Engine Code turbo-only (3) Turbo Code eiom (4) EIOM Code (for many Ethernet/802.3 IOMs) hiom (5) HSSI IOM Code tiom (6) Token Ring IOM Code fiom (7) FIOM Code ifiom (8) Intelligent FIOM Code ttiom (9) Turbo Token Ring IOM Code eiom8 (10) Octal EIOM Code feiom (11) Fast Ethernet IOM code.

swSizes.name: swSizes
swSizes.description: An array (4 octets per file), containing the size of each of the files. Each size is encoded as a series of 4 bytes, which should be converted into a 32 bit integer.

swStarts.name: swStarts
swStarts.description: An array (4 octets per file), containing the software's execution starting address of each of the files. Each address is encoded as a series of 4 bytes, which should be converted into a 32 bit integer.

swBases.name: swBases
swBases.description: An array (4 octets per file), containing the software's base loading address of each of the files. Each address is encoded as a series of 4 bytes, which should be converted into a 32 bit integer.

swFlashBank.name: swFlashBank
swFlashBank.description: The bank number where the software file set resides.

configFatalErr.name: configFatalErr
configFatalErr.description: This is a 32 byte array which contains information about the cause of the previous system reset. This will describe the circumstances which forced the system software to perform a reboot. The values in the first byte have the following meanings (0) Power failure, (1) Watchdog Timeout, (2) NMS Requested Shutdown, (3-255) Fatal Error (next byte contains the hwIndex of the module which encountered the error; remaining 30 bytes contain additional information).

configAnyPass.name: configAnyPass
configAnyPass.description: The authentication password (0-24 bytes) which must match the community name in an SNMP PDU, in order for the operation to be performed. A zero length password indicates that any community name is acceptable.

configGetPass.name: configGetPass
configGetPass.description: The authentication password (0-24 bytes) which must match the community name in an SNMP Get PDU (except for Debug or password parameters). A zero length password indicates that any community name is acceptable. Alternatively, it is acceptable if the community name matches configAnyPass.

configNMSAddress.name: configNMSAddress
configNMSAddress.description: The address of the NMS to which Trap PDUs are to be sent. A value of zero indicates that Trap PDUs should be sent to the NMS last heard from.

configFunctions.name: configFunctions
configFunctions.description: A bit field which describes the software functions supported by this ES/1. The possible values are: 0x0001 NMS, 0x0002 TBRIDGE, 0x0004 SBRIDGE, 0x0008 MESH, 0x0010 IPROUTER, 0x0020 NO_BPDU, 0x0040 RIP, 0x0100 PROXY, 0x0200 OSPF, 0x0400 IPX.

configPowerAc1.name: configPowerAc1
configPowerAc1.description: Whether the first power supply has AC input.

configPowerAc2.name: configPowerAc2
configPowerAc2.description: Whether the second power supply has AC input.

configPowerDc1.name: configPowerDc1
configPowerDc1.description: Whether the first power supply provides DC voltage.

configPowerDc2.name: configPowerDc2
configPowerDc2.description: Whether the second power supply provides DC voltage.

configPowerPresent1.name: configPowerPresent1
configPowerPresent1.description: Whether the first power supply is present.

configPowerPresent2.name: configPowerPresent2
configPowerPresent2.description: Whether the second power supply is present.

configAlarmDynamic.name: configAlarmDynamic
configAlarmDynamic.description: Whether changes in dynamic parameters (except for the dynamically learned addresses) should cause enterprise specific trap PDUs to be generated.

configAlarmAddresses.name: configAlarmAddresses
configAlarmAddresses.description: Whether changes in the dynamically learned addresses should cause enterprise specific trap PDUs to be generated.

configStorageFailure.name: configStorageFailure
configStorageFailure.description: Whether the ES/1's storage facility for its configuration parameters has failed (the ES/1 may not be able to reboot after such a failure).

configAuthenticationFailure.name: configAuthenticationFailure
configAuthenticationFailure.description: All nulls, or the IP source address within the last SNMP PDU which caused an SNMP authentication failure.

configFddiPriority.name: configFddiPriority
configFddiPriority.description: Priority to use when forwarding packets to any FDDI port from any non-FDDI port.

configTprPriority.name: configTprPriority
configTprPriority.description: Priority to use when forwarding packets to any Token-Ring port from any non-Token-Ring port.

configDumpModule.name: configDumpModule
configDumpModule.description: Flag to select the module to dump on a crash. If set to a value of 1 to 7 the relevant module's memory will be sent to the UART port on detecting a fatal error situation. A value of zero will disable the dump option. A value of 1 selects the ME, 7 selects the TURBO, and 2-6 select IOMs.

configDumpStart.name: configDumpStart
configDumpStart.description: Starting address of memory to dump upon detecting a fatal error.

configDumpEnd.name: configDumpEnd
configDumpEnd.description: Ending address of memory to dump upon detecting a fatal error.

lmaAllAddr.name: lmaAllAddr
lmaAllAddr.description: The IEEE All LANs Bridge Management Group Address 01-80-c2-00-00-10. Changing lmaAllAddr will not take effect until the ES/1 reboots.

lmaAnyAddr.name: lmaAnyAddr
lmaAnyAddr.description: A spare LMA address, which is always all zeroes. Changing lmaAllAny will not take effect until the ES/1 reboots.

ppeLrgUxRxCnt.name: ppeLrgUxRxCnt
ppeLrgUxRxCnt.description: The number of large data buffers to allocate for the PPE to create packets. This value may be changed automatically by the ES/1 as a result of enabling IPX routing. The ES/1 will calculate the minimum number of such buffers that are needed for the number of configured ports and may adjust this count upward if needed.

ppeSmlUxRxCnt.name: ppeSmlUxRxCnt
ppeSmlUxRxCnt.description: The number of small data buffers to allocate for the PPE to create packets.

ppeUxTxCnt.name: ppeUxTxCnt
ppeUxTxCnt.description: The maximum number of received packets destined to the ES/1 itself (versus those received packets to be forwarded) which can be stored, until the PPE is able to process them.

ppeSmlBuffSize.name: ppeSmlBuffSize
ppeSmlBuffSize.description: The size (in bytes) of the PPE's small data buffers.

ppeBridgingMemory.name: ppeBridgingMemory
ppeBridgingMemory.description: The percentage (1 - 99) of the PPE's memory that is allocated for MAC bridging. The PPE's remaining memory will be used for communicating with the NMS and for routing. Operationally, a value between 70 percent and 99 percent will be treated as 70 percent. This allows for approximately 8000 learned addresses (bridging) and either 1600 TCP/IP routes or 1200 IPX RIP/SAP pairs. To increase the space available for routing, set rebootBridgingMemory to a value less than 70 percent.

ppeExtendStats.name: ppeExtendStats
ppeExtendStats.description: Whether the PPE should accumulate extended statistics. Extended statistics are tallies, such as byte counts, which are not essential for everyday ES/1 management, and which may have a slightly detrimental effect on performance.

ppeBAddrLimit.name: ppeBAddrLimit
ppeBAddrLimit.description: The maximum number of addresses that the PPE should learn for bridging purposes. The remaining address entries will be used for routing related addresses.

ppeTxCongests.name: ppeTxCongests
ppeTxCongests.description: Number of packets not received due to internal buffer congestion.

ppeArpEntries.name: ppeArpEntries
ppeArpEntries.description: The number of ARP entries for all interfaces.

ppeArpStatics.name: ppeArpStatics
ppeArpStatics.description: The number of statically defined ARP entries for all interfaces.

ppeArpOverflows.name: ppeArpOverflows
ppeArpOverflows.description: The number of times a ARP entry could not be learned due to insufficient address table space.

ppeIpEntries.name: ppeIpEntries
ppeIpEntries.description: The number of IP Routing Database entries.

ppeIpStatics.name: ppeIpStatics
ppeIpStatics.description: The number of statically defined IP Routing Database entries.

ppeStaticPreference.name: ppeStaticPreference
ppeStaticPreference.description: The value to assign to ipRouteMetric2, when adding a statically-defined entry to the IP Routing Table.

ppeOspfPreference.name: ppeOspfPreference
ppeOspfPreference.description: The value to assign to ipRouteMetric2, when adding an OSPF-learned entry to the IP Routing Table.

ppeRipPreference.name: ppeRipPreference
ppeRipPreference.description: The value to assign to ipRouteMetric2, when adding a RIP-learned entry to the IP Routing Table.

ppeEgpPreference.name: ppeEgpPreference
ppeEgpPreference.description: The value to assign to ipRouteMetric2, when adding an EGP-learned entry to the IP Routing Table.

ppeCpuUtilization.name: ppeCpuUtilization
ppeCpuUtilization.description: The current CPU utilization on the Packet Processing Engine.

ppeRipRouteDiscards.name: ppeRipRouteDiscards
ppeRipRouteDiscards.description: The number of times a route learned via RIP was not added to the IP Routing Table due to insufficient Routing Table space.

ppeOspfRouteDiscards.name: ppeOspfRouteDiscards
ppeOspfRouteDiscards.description: The number of times a route learned via OSPF was not added to the IP Routing Table due to insufficient Routing Table space (currently always zero).

ppeRouteMemorySize.name: ppeRouteMemorySize
ppeRouteMemorySize.description: The number of bytes originally given to the routing table heap.

ppeRouteMemoryAvail.name: ppeRouteMemoryAvail
ppeRouteMemoryAvail.description: The number of bytes currently available in the routing table heap.

ppeRouteMemoryFailures.name: ppeRouteMemoryFailures
ppeRouteMemoryFailures.description: The number of unsuccessful attempts to allocate from the routing table heap.

ppePacketMemorySize.name: ppePacketMemorySize
ppePacketMemorySize.description: The number of bytes originally given to the packet heap.

ppePacketMemoryAvail.name: ppePacketMemoryAvail
ppePacketMemoryAvail.description: The number of bytes currently available in the packet heap.

ppePacketMemoryFailures.name: ppePacketMemoryFailures
ppePacketMemoryFailures.description: The number of unsuccessful attempts to allocate from the packet heap.

ppeOspfPduMemoryFailures.name: ppeOspfPduMemoryFailures
ppeOspfPduMemoryFailures.description: Number of unsuccessful attempts to allocate memory for an OSPF PDU.

ppeOspfPduMemoryAllocs.name: ppeOspfPduMemoryAllocs
ppeOspfPduMemoryAllocs.description: Number of times memory was allocated for an OSPF PDU.

ppeIcmpPduMemoryFailures.name: ppeIcmpPduMemoryFailures
ppeIcmpPduMemoryFailures.description: Number of unsuccessful attempts to allocate memory for an ICMP PDU.

ppeIcmpPduMemoryAllocs.name: ppeIcmpPduMemoryAllocs
ppeIcmpPduMemoryAllocs.description: Number of times memory was allocated for an ICMP PDU.

ppeRipPduMemoryFailures.name: ppeRipPduMemoryFailures
ppeRipPduMemoryFailures.description: Number of unsuccessful attempts to allocate memory for a RIP PDU.

ppeRipPduMemoryAllocs.name: ppeRipPduMemoryAllocs
ppeRipPduMemoryAllocs.description: Number of times memory was allocated for a RIP PDU.

ppeBootpPduMemoryFailures.name: ppeBootpPduMemoryFailures
ppeBootpPduMemoryFailures.description: Number of unsuccessful attempts to allocate memory for a BOOTP PDU.

ppeBootpPduMemoryAllocs.name: ppeBootpPduMemoryAllocs
ppeBootpPduMemoryAllocs.description: Number of times memory was allocated for a BOOTP PDU.

ppeSnmpPduMemoryFailures.name: ppeSnmpPduMemoryFailures
ppeSnmpPduMemoryFailures.description: Number of unsuccessful attempts to allocate memory for an SNMP PDU.

ppeSnmpPduMemoryAllocs.name: ppeSnmpPduMemoryAllocs
ppeSnmpPduMemoryAllocs.description: Number of times memory was allocated for an SNMP PDU.

ppeTftpPduMemoryFailures.name: ppeTftpPduMemoryFailures
ppeTftpPduMemoryFailures.description: Number of unsuccessful attempts to allocate memory for a TFTP PDU.

ppeTftpPduMemoryAllocs.name: ppeTftpPduMemoryAllocs
ppeTftpPduMemoryAllocs.description: Number of times memory was allocated for a TFTP PDU.

ppeTraceroutePduMemoryFailures.name: ppeTraceroutePduMemoryFailures
ppeTraceroutePduMemoryFailures.description: Number of unsuccessful attempts to allocate memory for a TraceRoute PDU.

ppeTraceroutePduMemoryAllocs.name: ppeTraceroutePduMemoryAllocs
ppeTraceroutePduMemoryAllocs.description: Number of times memory was allocated for a TraceRoute PDU.

ppeArpPduMemoryFailures.name: ppeArpPduMemoryFailures
ppeArpPduMemoryFailures.description: Number of unsuccessful attempts to allocate memory for a ARP PDU.

ppeArpPduMemoryAllocs.name: ppeArpPduMemoryAllocs
ppeArpPduMemoryAllocs.description: Number of times memory was allocated for a ARP PDU.

ppeIgmpPduMemoryFailures.name: ppeIgmpPduMemoryFailures
ppeIgmpPduMemoryFailures.description: Number of unsuccessful attempts to allocate memory for a IGMP PDU.

ppeIgmpPduMemoryAllocs.name: ppeIgmpPduMemoryAllocs
ppeIgmpPduMemoryAllocs.description: Number of times memory was allocated for a IGMP PDU.

ppeAresAsStes.name: ppeAresAsStes
ppeAresAsStes.description: If true, all-routes-explorers will be treated as if they were spanning-tree-explorers.

ppeMgtMemorySize.name: ppeMgtMemorySize
ppeMgtMemorySize.description: The number of bytes originally given to the local management agent heap.

ppeMgtMemoryAvail.name: ppeMgtMemoryAvail
ppeMgtMemoryAvail.description: The number of bytes currently available in the local management agent heap.

ppeMgtMemoryFailures.name: ppeMgtMemoryFailures
ppeMgtMemoryFailures.description: The number of unsuccessful attempts to allocate from the local management agent heap.

stGroupAddr.name: stGroupAddr
stGroupAddr.description: The Spanning Tree Group address, normally 01-80-c2-00-00-00. Changing stGroupAddr will not take effect until the ES/1 reboots.

stResAddr.name: stResAddr
stResAddr.description: A series of 90 octets containing the Spanning Tree's 15 reserved addres 01-80-c2-00-00-01 through 01-80-c2-00-00-0f). Changing stResAddr will not take effect until the ES/1 reboots.

stTopChange.name: stTopChange
stTopChange.description: Whether a topology change is currently in progress.

stTopChangeCount.name: stTopChangeCount
stTopChangeCount.description: The number of spanning tree topology changes which have occurred, since the ES/1 was last booted (or this parameter was last reset by the NMS).

stTopChangeTime.name: stTopChangeTime
stTopChangeTime.description: If stTopChange is True, then the time since stTopChange changed from False to True. If stTopChange is False, then the time since stTopChange changed from True to False.

swdisDesc.name: swdisDesc
swdisDesc.description: The description (0-32 bytes) of the software set currently being downloaded, or a description of the software set last downloaded since the ES/1 booted.

swdisAccess.name: swdisAccess
swdisAccess.description: The version of software that may be downloaded. Attempts to download other versions of software will be rejected. The value for swdisAccess is embedded within the software files that are to be distributed via TFTP. Its value may be derived from the names of the software files. the NMS operator may wish to use the following special values: protected (1) No software downloads will be accepted any-software (2) A software download of any version of new software will be accepted - this is the factory default

swdisWriteStatus.name: swdisWriteStatus
swdisWriteStatus.description: The status of the erase/write operation.

swdisConfigIp.name: swdisConfigIp
swdisConfigIp.description: The IP address of the NMS (i.e., any IP host) that is allowed to use TFTP to send/retrieve the configuration file of the ES/1. A value of 0.0.0.0 (which is the factory specified default) prevents any NMS from obtaining access, while a value of 255.255.255.255 gives every NMS permission.

swdisConfigRetryTime.name: swdisConfigRetryTime
swdisConfigRetryTime.description: The number of seconds that the ES/1 will wait for an acknowledgment before it retransmits an unacknowledged TFTP data block. The factory specified default is 5 seconds.

swdisConfigTotalTimeout.name: swdisConfigTotalTimeout
swdisConfigTotalTimeout.description: The number of seconds that the ES/1 will wait for an acknowledgment to a data block before it cancels a TFTP session. The factory specified default is 25 seconds.

addrStatics.name: addrStatics
addrStatics.description: The number of static addresses which are currently stored in the ES/1.

addrDynamics.name: addrDynamics
addrDynamics.description: The number of learned addresses in the address table.

addrDynamicMax.name: addrDynamicMax
addrDynamicMax.description: The maximum number of spanning tree addresses which have been learned since the ES/1 was last booted (or this parameter was last reset by the NMS).

addrMeshs.name: addrMeshs
addrMeshs.description: The number of ATM, Frame Relay, and/or SMDS addresses in the address table. These addresses are not reflected within addrStatics nor addrDynamics. [ATM, Frame Relay, and SMDS are not yet implemented.]

addrDynamicOverflows.name: addrDynamicOverflows
addrDynamicOverflows.description: The number times an address was not learned due to insufficient address table space.

addrMeshOverflows.name: addrMeshOverflows
addrMeshOverflows.description: The number of times an ATM, Frame Relay, or SMDS address could not be learned due to insufficient address table space. [ATM, Frame Relay, and SMDS are not yet implemented.]

addrFlags.name: addrFlags
addrFlags.description: Flags to describe the use and control of this address entry. Each bit has a different meaning. The NMS must always set either entry-static, entry-none, or entry-mesh; however, for GetRequests, the NMS will see either no bits set (if the entry does not exist), or exactly one of the following bits set: entry-dynamic-local = 30,entry-dynamic-remote = 29, entry-static = 28, entry-other = 27, entry-none = 26, entry-mesh = 25, entry-statistics = 24,Bit 31 is reserved. Any combination of the restriction bits (bits 23-21) may be set for any type of entry, except entry-other or entry-mesh: entry-no-source = 23, entry-no-multi = 22, Bit 21 is reserved, Bits 20-18 are reserved. Exactly one of the special entry bits (bits 17-10) must be set for entry-other entries, and none of the bits may be set for other than entry-other entries: entry-all-lmas = 17, entry-any-lma = 16, entry-lma = 15, entry-port = 14, entry-bpdu = 13, entry-reserved = 12, Bits 11-10 are reserved for future expansion. Bits 9-0 are reserved.

addrMAC.name: addrMAC
addrMAC.description: The MAC address for this address definition.

addrPort.name: addrPort
addrPort.description: The port through which this address is connected to the ES/1 (only valid for entry-dynamic-local, entry-statistics, and entry-port entries).

addrPortMap.name: addrPortMap
addrPortMap.description: This is a bitmap of up to 32 sets of 32 bits each (128 octets), which defines which source ports are allowed to forward packets to which destination ports. Within each set of four octets, each bit is set if a packet with a matching destination address may be forwarded to that port.Since only the ES/1's ports 2 through 21 are available for bridging, all unused bits as well as the first 8 octets as well as the last 40 octets are meaningless.

addrOperation.name: addrOperation
addrOperation.description: The operation to be performed upon the described address. The possibilities include: read-random (1), read-next (2), zero-stats (3), update (4), delete (5), read-block (6).

addrIndex.name: addrIndex
addrIndex.description: The index number to be used for read-next and read-block operations. When the ES/1 boots, addrIndex is initialized to -1.

addrNext.name: addrNext
addrNext.description: The next value to use for addrIndex, when you use read-next or read-block operations to read the address table. When the ES/1 boots, addrNext is initialized to -1.

addrAge.name: addrAge
addrAge.description: The time, in centiseconds, since a packet was last received from the address on a port that was in Spanning Tree learning or forwarding state. If no packets have been received, then addrAge contains the time that the address was created on the ES/1.

addrRxPkts.name: addrRxPkts
addrRxPkts.description: The number of packets received from the address on a port that was in Spanning Tree learning or forwarding state (can be zeroed by zero-stats).

addrRxChars.name: addrRxChars
addrRxChars.description: The number of characters in the packets received from the address on a port that was in Spanning Tree Learning or Forwarding state (can be zeroed by zero-stats).

addrRxMultiPkts.name: addrRxMultiPkts
addrRxMultiPkts.description: The number of multicast packets received from the address on a port that was in Spanning Tree Learning or Forwarding state (can be zeroed by zero-stats).

addrRxFwdPkts.name: addrRxFwdPkts
addrRxFwdPkts.description: The number of packets received from the address which were forwarded (can be zeroed by zero-stats). This includes packets that were MAC-layer bridged because they were received on a port that was in Spanning Tree forwarding state, and packets that were routed regardless of the port's Spanning Tree state.

addrTxPkts.name: addrTxPkts
addrTxPkts.description: The number of packets transmitted to the address (can be zeroed by zero-stats).

addrTxChars.name: addrTxChars
addrTxChars.description: The number of characters in the packets transmitted to the address (can be zeroed by zero-stats).

addrBlockSize.name: addrBlockSize
addrBlockSize.description: The number of addresses contained by addrBlock.This parameter is only used for dumping blocks of MAC addresses.

addrBlock.name: addrBlock
addrBlock.description: A series of 0-700 octets, which represents 0-100 addresses. Each address consists of a 6 octet MacAddress followed by a 1 byte port number. If the port number is zero, then the address is that of a specially configured address; otherwise, the address is a dynamically learned address. This parameter is only used for dumping blocks of MAC addresses.

addrAlarmMAC.name: addrAlarmMAC
addrAlarmMAC.description: The MAC address for an address entry. This parameter is only used by the ES/1's enterprise specific trap mechanism.

addrRptrPort.name: addrRptrPort
addrRptrPort.description: The repeater port through which this address is connected to the port indicated by addrPort. This parameter is only valid if the port's srepeaterExtendedStats is enabled, and if the ES/1's ppeExtendStats is true.

fddismtTable.name: fddismtTable
fddismtTable.description: A list of snmpsmt entries, one per FDDI board.

fddismtEntry.name: fddismtEntry
fddismtEntry.description: A set of objects for an interface entry.

fddismtIndex.name: fddismtIndex
fddismtIndex.description: A unique value for each SMT. It represents the sequence number of the FDDI board in ES/1.

fddismtUpstreamReq.name: fddismtUpstreamReq
fddismtUpstreamReq.description: When this variable is written, the ES/1 converts it into a big-endian FDDI address and issues an SMT NIF request to determine that address's upstream neighbor. When the NIF response is received, snmpsmtUpstreamRsp will hold the address of the upstream neighbor and a trap will be sent to the NMS.

fddismtUpstreamRsp.name: fddismtUpstreamRsp
fddismtUpstreamRsp.description: The address of the upstream neighbor of the ES/1 whose address was written into snmpsmtUpstreamReq. If the address has not yet been learned, then an address of all zeroes is returned.

fddismtUpstreamDescriptor.name: fddismtUpstreamDescriptor
fddismtUpstreamDescriptor.description: A four byte string containing the upstream neighbor's Station Descriptor parameter, as defined by the SMT frame protocols. If the upstream neighbor has not yet been learned, then a string of all zeroes is returned.

fddismtUpstreamState.name: fddismtUpstreamState
fddismtUpstreamState.description: A four byte string containing the upstream neighbor's Station State parameter, as defined by the SMT frame protocols. If the upstream neighbor has not yet been learned, then a string of all zeroes is returned.

sifUX.name: sifUX
sifUX.description: The maximum number of receive data buffers supported by the ES/1. The sum of sifSmlRxCnt and sifLrgRxCnt for all ports, plus ppeSmlRxCnt and ppeLrgRxCnt must be less than or equal to sifUX.

sifTable.name: sifTable
sifTable.description: A list of interface entries; one per port.

sifEntry.name: sifEntry
sifEntry.description: A set of objects for an interface entry.

sifIndex.name: sifIndex
sifIndex.description: The port number, beginning with 1 for the first port.

sifSmlRxCnt.name: sifSmlRxCnt
sifSmlRxCnt.description: The number of small data buffers for receiving packets.

sifLrgRxCnt.name: sifLrgRxCnt
sifLrgRxCnt.description: The number of large data buffers for receiving packets; must be zero for CSMA and UART ports.

sifUxTxCnt.name: sifUxTxCnt
sifUxTxCnt.description: The maximum size of the port's transmit queue, i.e., the number of packets that can be in the port's transmit queue, waiting to be transmitted.

sifThreshold.name: sifThreshold
sifThreshold.description: Maximum number of combined receive and transmit packet hardware errors before an alarm should be generated.

sifThresholdTime.name: sifThresholdTime
sifThresholdTime.description: The time period (in seconds) to which sifThreshold applies. A value of zero will disable the sifThreshold alarm.

sifRxQueueThresh.name: sifRxQueueThresh
sifRxQueueThresh.description: Maximum number of receive packet queue overflow errors before an alarm should be generated.

sifRxQueueThreshTime.name: sifRxQueueThreshTime
sifRxQueueThreshTime.description: The time period (in seconds) to which sifRxQueueThresh applies. A value of zero will disable the sifRxQueueThresh alarm.

sifTxStormCnt.name: sifTxStormCnt
sifTxStormCnt.description: The maximum number of multicasts to transmit with a certain period of time (not applicable for UART ports).

sifTxStormTime.name: sifTxStormTime
sifTxStormTime.description: The period of time, in centiseconds, which qualifies sifTxStormCnt (not applicable for UART ports).

sifFilterFlags.name: sifFilterFlags
sifFilterFlags.description: Special filter flags; any combination of the following bits: 0x0001 NO_SOURCE_SAME, 0x0002 NO_SOURCE_LEARNT, 0x0004 NO_LEARNING, 0x0008 NO_DEST_LEARNT

sifCongestTime.name: sifCongestTime
sifCongestTime.description: When a port becomes congested, the PPE will discard any packets destined to the port for this many centiseconds following the congestion alarm. Possible values 0 through 5 minutes, except for port 1 (the out-of-band management port) which is always 0.

sifQueueTime.name: sifQueueTime
sifQueueTime.description: The time, in centiseconds, after which an element in a transmit queue will be flushed.

sifFunctions.name: sifFunctions
sifFunctions.description: The current functional state (protocols which have been activated and are operational) of the port. The following values or combinations are supported: 0x0001 NMS, 0x0002 TBRIDGE, 0x0004 SBRIDGE, 0x0006 SRTBRIDGE, 0x0008 MESH, 0x0010 IPROUTE, 0x0020 NO_BPDU, 0x0040 RIP, 0x0080 SRSPAN, 0x0100 PROXY, 0x0200 OSPF. These values can be configured through the sprotoTable. Combining TBRIDGE and SBRIDGE always produces SRTBRIDGE.

sifCongested.name: sifCongested
sifCongested.description: Whether the port is out-bound congested.

sifRxPackets.name: sifRxPackets
sifRxPackets.description: A 100 byte array, containing the number of received packets broken down into 25 categories. The number of packets in each category is encoded as a series of 4 bytes, which should be converted into a 32 bit counter. The 25 categories are determined by combining each possible DEST_xxx value with each possible OUTCOME_xxx value, as listed below: DEST_UBRIDGE = 0, DEST_MBRIDGE = 1, DEST_KNOWN = 2, DEST_UNKNOWN = 3, DEST_MULTI = 4, OUTCOME_FWD = 0, OUTCOME_LOCAL = 5, OUTCOME_BLOCK = 10, OUTCOME_SOURCE = 15, OUTCOME_DEST = 20

sifRxChar0s.name: sifRxChar0s
sifRxChar0s.description: Number of characters in the forwarded received packets.

sifRxChar1s.name: sifRxChar1s
sifRxChar1s.description: Number of characters in the filtered received packets.

sifRxSizeErrors.name: sifRxSizeErrors
sifRxSizeErrors.description: Number of received packets discarded due to size errors.

sifRxHwFCSs.name: sifRxHwFCSs
sifRxHwFCSs.description: Number of received packets discarded due to FCS errors.

sifRxQueues.name: sifRxQueues
sifRxQueues.description: Number of received packets lost because of insufficient receive buffers.(For certain interfaces with multi-packet FIFO hardware, this count might be approximate.)

sifTxPackets.name: sifTxPackets
sifTxPackets.description: A 20 byte array, containing the number of transmitted packets broken down into 5 categories. The number of packets in each category is encoded as a series of 4 bytes, which should be converted into a 32 bit counter.

sifTxStorms.name: sifTxStorms
sifTxStorms.description: Number of packets not sent due to protection against a multicast storm.

sifTxDests.name: sifTxDests
sifTxDests.description: Number of packets not sent due to a destination port filtering restriction.

sifErrorsFlag.name: sifErrorsFlag
sifErrorsFlag.description: Whether the port has exceeded the limits specified by sifThreshold and sifThresholdTime.

sifTxStormFlag.name: sifTxStormFlag
sifTxStormFlag.description: Whether PPE has invoked multicast storm protection.

sifTxSizes.name: sifTxSizes
sifTxSizes.description: Number of packets not sent due to size limitations.

sifTxAddr.name: sifTxAddr
sifTxAddr.description: A series of 16 MAC addresses (96 octets in total), of the source addresses of the last 16 packets that were not sent due to packet size limitations. If fewer than 16 packets were not sent, then the unspecified MAC addresses will be all zeroes.

sifLan.name: sifLan
sifLan.description: Up to four group identifiers assigned to the port. The sifLan identifier is only used by combination filter testing, i.e., for comparisons against filterSrcLan. Possible values are 0 through 255, for each of the parameter's four bytes.

sifStatisticsTime.name: sifStatisticsTime
sifStatisticsTime.description: Length of time during which statistics were collected. In particular, the following statistics may be examined to determine the exact utilization rate of a port: ifInOctets, ifInUcastPkts, ifInNUcastPkts ifOutOctets, ifOutUcastPkts, ifOutNUcastPkts sifRxChar0s, sifRxChar1s.

sifIpAddress.name: sifIpAddress
sifIpAddress.description: The IP address assigned to the port. If this is zero, then the port must learn its IP address via Reverse ARP or PPP's IPCP.

sifIpGroupAddress.name: sifIpGroupAddress
sifIpGroupAddress.description: Zero, or an IP Group address assigned to the port.

sifMaxPacketSize.name: sifMaxPacketSize
sifMaxPacketSize.description: The maximum packet size, in bytes (octets), which may be transmitted through this port. This parameter may not be changed, except for PPP ports, in which case, changing sifMaxPacketSize automatically causes ifMtu and pppLinkLocalMRU to change.

sifExpectSqe.name: sifExpectSqe
sifExpectSqe.description: Whether the port should expect SQE, also known as heartbeat (not applicable for ports other than CSMA/CD ports).

sifFilterLocal.name: sifFilterLocal
sifFilterLocal.description: Whether the port should attempt to filter local traffic, bypassing all statistics accumulation, rather than passing the local traffic to the Packet Processing Engine. Filtering local traffic is not available for UART and WAN ports.

sifInQLen.name: sifInQLen
sifInQLen.description: The maximum length ever obtained by the port's inbound packet queue (in packets). The size of a port's inbound packet queue is periodically polled (rather than recalculated whenever a packet is added), so sifInQLen is an approximation of the maximum length.

sifFrameSwitching.name: sifFrameSwitching
sifFrameSwitching.description: Valid only for Token Ring ports. Options include: enabled (1), disabled (2).Defaults to disabled(2). If enabled, frames may be bridged between token ring ports on the same board at higher throughput and lower latency than is otherwise possible. Address statistics will not reflect any frames forwarded in this manner. This applies only to transparent bridging, and must be enabled on both the entry and the exit port.

sifRingDrops.name: sifRingDrops
sifRingDrops.description: Only valid for 802.5 token ring. Number of times the ring left the open state.

sifAdapterChecks.name: sifAdapterChecks
sifAdapterChecks.description: Only valid for 802.5 token ring. Number of times the MAC chip experienced an internal hardware failure and had to be reset.

sifIpRipPortMetric.name: sifIpRipPortMetric
sifIpRipPortMetric.description: Port metric for backup RIP interface.

sifDescr.name: sifDescr
sifDescr.description: A textual string containing information about the interface. This string should include the name of the manufacturer, the product name and the version of the hardware interface.

sifUtilInterval.name: sifUtilInterval
sifUtilInterval.description: The number of seconds in each utilization sample.

sifUtilCount.name: sifUtilCount
sifUtilCount.description: The number of same-kind peak samples per physical port accumulated in sifUtilPortPeakTable or sifUtilSysPeakTable.

sifUtilPortPeakReset.name: sifUtilPortPeakReset
sifUtilPortPeakReset.description: This object is set to true (1) to erase earlier per-physical-port utilization samples on all specified port(s).

sifUtilPortPeakTable.name: sifUtilPortPeakTable
sifUtilPortPeakTable.description: A list of interface utilization entries; one per sifUtilCount per physical port, plus one per physical port for the most recently completed samples.

sifUtilPortPeakEntry.name: sifUtilPortPeakEntry
sifUtilPortPeakEntry.description: A set of utilization statistics recorded for an interface entry at per-port throughput peaks.

sifUtilPortPeakOrdinal.name: sifUtilPortPeakOrdinal
sifUtilPortPeakOrdinal.description: The ordinal of the entry, with 1 representing 'Now' (i.e. the sample most recently accumulated), with 2 representing the sample taken at the highest per-port throughput peak, 3 at the next highest, and so on.

sifUtilPortPeakBRTimestamp.name: sifUtilPortPeakBRTimestamp
sifUtilPortPeakBRTimestamp.description: The value of sysUpTime associated with the end of the sample period for the associated sifUtilPortPeakTBitRate/sifUtilPortPeakRBitRate sample, or the most recent timestamp for the sample currently being accumulated. This will be 0 for any ports for which utilization statistics are not kept, or where statistics have been reset too recently to have accumulated an appropriate sample.

sifUtilPortPeakTBitRate.name: sifUtilPortPeakTBitRate
sifUtilPortPeakTBitRate.description: The ratio of the number of bits transmitted per second during the per-physical-port sample interval to the linespeed in bits per second, expressed in integer units of 1/100, maximum 99. This will be 0 for any ports for which utilization statistics are not kept, or where statistics have been reset too recently to have accumulated an appropriate sample.

sifUtilPortPeakRBitRate.name: sifUtilPortPeakRBitRate
sifUtilPortPeakRBitRate.description: The ratio of the number of bits received per second during the per-physical-port sample interval to the linespeed in bits per second, expressed in integer units of 1/100, maximum 99, and excluding some or all locally-filtered traffic per sifFilterLocal. This will be 0 for any ports for which utilization statistics are not kept, or where statistics have been reset too recently to have accumulated an appropriate sample.

sifUtilSysPeakReset.name: sifUtilSysPeakReset
sifUtilSysPeakReset.description: This object is set to true (1) to erase earlier per-system utilization samples.

sifUtilSysPeakTable.name: sifUtilSysPeakTable
sifUtilSysPeakTable.description: A list of interface utilization entries; one per sifUtilCount per physical port, plus one per physical port for the most recently completed samples.

sifUtilSysPeakEntry.name: sifUtilSysPeakEntry
sifUtilSysPeakEntry.description: A set of utilization statistics recorded for an interface entry at overall system throughput peaks.

sifUtilSysPeakOrdinal.name: sifUtilSysPeakOrdinal
sifUtilSysPeakOrdinal.description: The ordinal of the entry, with 1 representing 'Now' (i.e. the sample most recently accumulated), with 2 representing the sample taken at the highest peak system throughput, 3 at the next highest, and so on.

sifUtilSysPeakTimestamp.name: sifUtilSysPeakTimestamp
sifUtilSysPeakTimestamp.description: The value of sysUpTime associated with the end of the sample period for the associated sifUtilSysPeakTBitRate/sifUtilSysPeakRBitRate sample, or the most recent timestamp for the sample currently being accumulated. This will be 0 for any ports for which utilization statistics are not kept, or where statistics have been reset too recently to have accumulated an appropriate sample.

sifUtilSysPeakTBitRate.name: sifUtilSysPeakTBitRate
sifUtilSysPeakTBitRate.description: The ratio of the number of bits transmitted per second during the per-system-peak sample interval to the linespeed in bits per second, expressed in integer units of 1/100, maximum 99. This will be 0 for any ports for which utilization statistics are not kept, or where statistics have been reset too recently to have accumulated an appropriate sample.

sifUtilSysPeakRBitRate.name: sifUtilSysPeakRBitRate
sifUtilSysPeakRBitRate.description: The ratio of the number of bits received per second during the per-system-peak sample interval to the linespeed in bits per second, expressed in integer units of 1/100, maximum 99, and excluding some or all locally-filtered traffic per sifFilterLocal. This will be 0 for any ports for which utilization statistics are not kept, or where statistics have been reset too recently to have accumulated an appropriate sample.

sfddiTable.name: sfddiTable
sfddiTable.description: A list of interface entries; one per FDDI port.

sfddiEntry.name: sfddiEntry
sfddiEntry.description: A set of objects for an interface entry.

sfddiIndex.name: sfddiIndex
sfddiIndex.description: The ES/1's port number of the port.

sfddiRxHwAborts.name: sfddiRxHwAborts
sfddiRxHwAborts.description: The number of packets that were discarded due to receive abort errors.

sfddiRxParitys.name: sfddiRxParitys
sfddiRxParitys.description: The number of packets that were discarded due to parity errors.

sfddiRxShorts.name: sfddiRxShorts
sfddiRxShorts.description: The number of packets that were discarded because they were too short.

sfddiDpcErrValue.name: sfddiDpcErrValue
sfddiDpcErrValue.description: Detailed status of the last DPC error.

sfddiRbcErrValue.name: sfddiRbcErrValue
sfddiRbcErrValue.description: Detailed status of the last RBC error. (FIOM MIB only)

sfddiTxAsync.name: sfddiTxAsync
sfddiTxAsync.description: Number of bytes to reserve in the DPC Buffer Memory for transmitting asynchronous packets.

sfddiShortAddressing.name: sfddiShortAddressing
sfddiShortAddressing.description: Whether any packets were received with 16 bit MAC addresses.

sfddiSmtConditions.name: sfddiSmtConditions
sfddiSmtConditions.description: SMT conditions which should be reported to the NMS via SNMP Traps. Possible values are any combination of the following bits: ring = 0x00000001, claim = 0x00000002, beacon = 0x00000004, tvx = 0x00000008, trt = 0x00000010, phy-invalid = 0x00000020, reset = 0x00000040, overflow = 0x00000080, dup = 0x00000100, lost = 0x00000200, restricted = 0x00000400, congestion = 0x00000800, token = 0x00001000, t4 = 0x00002000.

sfddiSrfConditions.name: sfddiSrfConditions
sfddiSrfConditions.description: SRF conditions which should be reported to the NMS via SNMP Traps. Possible values are any combination of the following bits: srf-frame-error = 0x00000001, srf-port-ler = 0x00000002, srf-not-copied = 0x00000004,srf-dup-addr = 0x00000008, srf-eb-error = 0x00000010,srf-config = 0x00000020, srf-connect = 0x00000040, srf-trace = 0x00000080, srf-neighbor = 0x00000100,srf-peer-wrap = 0x00000400, srf-path-change = 0x00000800

sfddiSmtConditionsStatus.name: sfddiSmtConditionsStatus
sfddiSmtConditionsStatus.description: Requested SMT conditions which are currently present. Writing to sfddiSmtConditionsStatus is used to acknowledge the SNMP traps.

sfddiSrfConditionsStatus.name: sfddiSrfConditionsStatus
sfddiSrfConditionsStatus.description: Requested SRF conditions which are currently present. Writing to sfddiSrfConditionsStatus is used to acknowledge the SNMP traps.

sfddiSBFlag.name: sfddiSBFlag
sfddiSBFlag.description: Whether the ECM's optical bypass is stuck, i.e., the current value of the SMT SB_Flag variable.

sfddiRxEbits.name: sfddiRxEbits
sfddiRxEbits.description: The number of packets that were discarded because another station had already set the E bit.

sfddiOBSFuseBad.name: sfddiOBSFuseBad
sfddiOBSFuseBad.description: Whether the fuse to the FDDI port's optical bypass is bad.

sfddiThruB.name: sfddiThruB
sfddiThruB.description: Whether to connect to the FDDI port B (not applicable for SAS).

sfddiStationDescriptor.name: sfddiStationDescriptor
sfddiStationDescriptor.description: A four byte string containing the FDDI port's Station Descriptor parameter, as defined by the SMT frame protocols.

sfddiStationState.name: sfddiStationState
sfddiStationState.description: A four byte string containing the FDDI port's Station State parameter, as defined by the SMT frame protocols.

sfddiDownstreamNbr.name: sfddiDownstreamNbr
sfddiDownstreamNbr.description: The MAC address of the FDDI port's downstream neighbor.

sfddiSMTBufferSize.name: sfddiSMTBufferSize
sfddiSMTBufferSize.description: The amount of packet buffer space to reserve for processing SMT frames. Possible values 9000 - 18000. (FIOM MIB only)

suartTable.name: suartTable
suartTable.description: A list of interface entries; one per UART port.

suartEntry.name: suartEntry
suartEntry.description: A set of objects for an interface entry.

suartIndex.name: suartIndex
suartIndex.description: The ES/1's port number of the port.

suartBaud.name: suartBaud
suartBaud.description: This is the desired baud rate. Only 1200 baud through 19,200 baud are supported by the ES/1.

suartModem.name: suartModem
suartModem.description: The expected modem signals; definitions of the different values are TBD.

suartAlignmentErrors.name: suartAlignmentErrors
suartAlignmentErrors.description: Number of received packets with frame alignment errors, since the port was last enabled.

suartOverrunErrors.name: suartOverrunErrors
suartOverrunErrors.description: Number of received packets with data overrun errors, since the port was last enabled.

filterMaxCount.name: filterMaxCount
filterMaxCount.description: The maximum number of combination filters that may be defined for the ES/1. This is always 100.

filterCurrentCount.name: filterCurrentCount
filterCurrentCount.description: The number of combination filters currently defined for the ES/1.

filterDeleteID.name: filterDeleteID
filterDeleteID.description: A filter identifier used for deleting filters. After the NMS sets this field, the ES/1 deletes the filterEntry that has a matching filter ID field, and resets this field to zero. The ES/1 then updates filterCurrentCount, filterNextID, and the entire filterTable.

filterNextID.name: filterNextID
filterNextID.description: A filter identifier used for adding filters.

filterAddID.name: filterAddID
filterAddID.description: A filter identifier used for adding filters. After the NMS sets this field, the ES/1 adds the filterEntry indexed by filterAddIndex. The ES/1 then updates filterCurrentCount, filterNextID, and the entire filterTable. Note that if filterAddID does not match filterNextID, then the ES/1 will not add the entry, since the SetRequest for filterAddID must have been a duplicate packet.

filterAddIndex.name: filterAddIndex
filterAddIndex.description: The index within filterTable, after which a filter should be added. If filterAddIndex contains zero, then the filter should be added as the first filterEntry within filterTable.

filterTable.name: filterTable
filterTable.description: A list of combination filters; one per defined filter. If fewer than filterMaxCount filters have been defined, then an additional filterEntry exists, which is used as part of the sequence for defining a new filter.

filterEntry.name: filterEntry
filterEntry.description: A set of objects for a combination filter.

filterIndex.name: filterIndex
filterIndex.description: This number always matches the instance of the filterEntry.

filterID.name: filterID
filterID.description: Identifier assigned to the filter, used for obtaining the value for filterDeleteID so that the filter can be deleted.

filterPortNo.name: filterPortNo
filterPortNo.description: The port number related to this filter.

filterComboType.name: filterComboType
filterComboType.description: Whether this is an entry filter (0), an exit filter(1), a port mirror entry filter (3), or a port mirror exit filter (4).

filterFlags.name: filterFlags
filterFlags.description: A set of flag bits which control the operation of the filter. Filters will not prevent packets from being accepted by the ES/1 as a final destination. The following bits are used: bit 13, bit 12, bit 11, bit 10. bits 9-8 used for filterFrame. bits 7-6 used for filterSource, filterSourceEnd, and filterSourceMask. bits 5-4 used for filterDest, filterDestEnd, and filterDestMask. bits 3-2 used for filterSrcLan. bits 1-0 used for filterField, filterOffset, and filterMask.

filterFrame.name: filterFrame
filterFrame.description: Ethernet protocol type (1501-65535), or one (1) to indicate any 802 frame, or two (2) to indicate any Ethernet frame, Note that a specific Ethernet protocol type may appear in either Ethernet format frames, or encapsulated within 802 format frames.

filterSourceMask.name: filterSourceMask
filterSourceMask.description: A bitmask to be applied to the packet's source address before checking it against filterSource and filterSourceEnd.

filterDestMask.name: filterDestMask
filterDestMask.description: A bitmask to be applied to the packet's destination address before checking it against filterDest and filterDestEnd.

filterSrcLan.name: filterSrcLan
filterSrcLan.description: Either the port number from which the packet is received, or the value of any one of the group identifiers defined by sifLan for that port.

filterOffset.name: filterOffset
filterOffset.description: Zero-based offset of an arbitrary field within the packet. Depending upon the value of filterFlags, the offset is relative to the start of the translated packet, beginning with the big endian MAC addresses; or, the offset is relative to the start of the data past the IP header (and, the packet must be an IP packet with a valid IP header); or, the offset is relative to the start of the data past the Source Routing information (presence of Source Routing information is optional).

filterField.name: filterField
filterField.description: An 8 octet value to be compared to the contents of the arbitrary field within the packet.

filterMask.name: filterMask
filterMask.description: An 8 octet mask to be applied to the arbitrary field within the packet, before comparing it to filterField.

filterThreshold.name: filterThreshold
filterThreshold.description: The number of filter invocations at which an alarm to the NMS should be generated.

filterThreshTime.name: filterThreshTime
filterThreshTime.description: The length of time, in seconds, to which filterThreshold applies. A value of zero indicates that no alarms should be sent to the NMS. Values greater than 3600 (i.e., one hour) are not allowed.

filterThreshFlag.name: filterThreshFlag
filterThreshFlag.description: Whether usage of this filter has exceeded the limits specified by filterThreshold and filterThreshTime, and the NMS has not yet acknowledged the alarm. Therefore, whenever the NMS reads this value, it will always be False; however, the NMS may receive alarms with this value set to True.

filterPktCnts.name: filterPktCnts
filterPktCnts.description: The total number of packets which were discarded due to this filter.

filterLastSrc.name: filterLastSrc
filterLastSrc.description: The source MAC address of the last packet which was discarded due to this filter

rebootBridgingMemory.name: rebootBridgingMemory
rebootBridgingMemory.description: The percentage (1 - 99) of the PPE's memory to be allocated for MAC bridging. The PPE's remaining memory will be used for communicating with the NMS and for routing.

rebootSlotTable.name: rebootSlotTable
rebootSlotTable.description: A list of the desired occupants of the slots; one per slot.

rebootEntry.name: rebootEntry
rebootEntry.description: A set of objects for each slot.

rebootIndex.name: rebootIndex
rebootIndex.description: The slot number, beginning with 1 for the first slot. This number always matches the instance of the rebootEntry.

rebootType.name: rebootType
rebootType.description: The desired module type of the slot.

rebootUseMod.name: rebootUseMod
rebootUseMod.description: Whether to use this module, not applicable for the Packet Processing Engine.

rebootPortType.name: rebootPortType
rebootPortType.description: This is a variable-length byte array where each element represents the types of the ports belonging to this module.

rebootConfig.name: rebootConfig
rebootConfig.description: The configuration file that will be used when the ES/1 reboots. This parameter is normally automatically set by the ES/1; however, an NMS may explicitly set it to either no-change (1) or revert-to-defaults (3).

rebootRouteMemory.name: rebootRouteMemory
rebootRouteMemory.description: Percentage of non-bridging memory to allocate for routing tables. The remainder will be used for transient packets such as ARP and RIP.

debugStringID.name: debugStringID
debugStringID.description: The number of debug text strings sent by the ES/1. This parameter is used by the ES/1's enterprise specific trap mechanism.

debugString.name: debugString
debugString.description: The last debug text string (0-80 bytes) sent by the ES/1.

debugTable.name: debugTable
debugTable.description: A list of the modules which may be debugged, with one module per slot defined by hwSlotTable.

debugEntry.name: debugEntry
debugEntry.description: A set of objects for each module.

debugIndex.name: debugIndex
debugIndex.description: The module number, beginning with 1 for the module in the first slot. This number always matches the instance of the debugEntry.

debugBase.name: debugBase
debugBase.description: The base address of the memory region to be examined or modified.

debugLength.name: debugLength
debugLength.description: The desired length, in words, of the memory region to be examined or modified. After the ES/1 performs the operation, debugLength is updated to indicate the length of memory that was actually examined or modified. If debugLength is updated to contain zero, then the module was not operational.

debugData.name: debugData
debugData.description: A series of 0-64 octets, which represents 0-16 words (this may change in the future, if the ES/1 has processors with word sizes of other than 4 bytes per word). When this variable is read, the LMA will use the values in debugBase and debugLength to return the contents of a specified memory range to the NMS. Similarly, when this variable is written, a specified area of memory will be overwritten with data supplied by the NMS.

lpbkTable.name: lpbkTable
lpbkTable.description: A list of interface entries; one per port.

lpbkEntry.name: lpbkEntry
lpbkEntry.description: A set of objects for an interface entry.

lpbkIndex.name: lpbkIndex
lpbkIndex.description: The port number, beginning with 1 for the first port.

lpbkOperation.name: lpbkOperation
lpbkOperation.description: The type of loopback being performed. Setting lpbkOperation to loopback-off causes loop back operation to terminate. Setting lpbkOperation to loopback-local or loopback-remote causes loopback operation to commence, and the ES/1 automatically resets lpbkOperation to loopback-off when the loopback operation has completed.

lpbkDestAddr.name: lpbkDestAddr
lpbkDestAddr.description: The MAC address of the target device, only needed for remote loopback.

lpbkPktNum.name: lpbkPktNum
lpbkPktNum.description: The number of loopback packets to be transmitted.

lpbkInterval.name: lpbkInterval
lpbkInterval.description: The desired time delay between the reception of a looped back packet, and the transmission of the next packet to be looped back.

lpbkPktLength.name: lpbkPktLength
lpbkPktLength.description: The length (in octets) of the loopback packet. The values of the data itself are automatically selected by the ES/1.

lpbkIncrements.name: lpbkIncrements
lpbkIncrements.description: The number of bytes of data to be added to the loopback packet after each successful loopback packet transmission and reception. When the port's maximum packet size has been reached, the ES/1 automatically begins again, starting with lpbkPktLength.

lpbkGoods.name: lpbkGoods
lpbkGoods.description: The number of packets successfully looped back. This number is automatically reset to zero, whenever loopback operation is initiated.

lpbkErrorNoReceives.name: lpbkErrorNoReceives
lpbkErrorNoReceives.description: The number of packets which were transmitted, but not received. This number is automatically reset to zero, whenever loopback operation is initiated.

lpbkErrorBadReceives.name: lpbkErrorBadReceives
lpbkErrorBadReceives.description: The number of transmitted packets which were received with different data patterns. This number is automatically reset to zero, whenever loopback operation is initiated.

lpbkErrorSize.name: lpbkErrorSize
lpbkErrorSize.description: The length of the last loopback packet which caused either lpbkErrorNoReceives or lpbkErrorBadReceives to be incremented. This number is automatically reset to zero, whenever loopback operation is initiated.

lpbkErrorSent.name: lpbkErrorSent
lpbkErrorSent.description: The transmitted bytes (0-4) of data within the last loopback packet which caused lpbkErrorBadReceives to be incremented. This parameter is automatically reset to the null string, whenever loopback operation is initiated.

lpbkErrorReceived.name: lpbkErrorReceived
lpbkErrorReceived.description: The received bytes (0-4) of data within the last loopback packet which caused lpbkErrorBadReceives to be incremented. This parameter is automatically reset to the null string, whenever loopback operation is initiated.

lpbkErrorOffset.name: lpbkErrorOffset
lpbkErrorOffset.description: The byte offset (one being the first byte) within the loopback packet where lpbkErrorSent begins. This number is automatically reset to zero, whenever loopback operation is initiated.

swanTable.name: swanTable
swanTable.description: A list of interface entries; one per WAN port.

swanEntry.name: swanEntry
swanEntry.description: A set of objects for an interface entry.

swanIndex.name: swanIndex
swanIndex.description: The ES/1's port number of the port.

swanActualSpeed.name: swanActualSpeed
swanActualSpeed.description: This is the actual line speed. The possible values are defined by suartSpeed. For HSSI, the speed is 45-megabits(11). If the RS-449 interface is being used on the HSSI IOM, the speed is always reported as 1.544-megabits(9); however, the external clock may be generating a slower speed.

swanIpNeighborAddress.name: swanIpNeighborAddress
swanIpNeighborAddress.description: Zero, or an IP address to assign to the port's neighbor.

swanOverrunErrors.name: swanOverrunErrors
swanOverrunErrors.description: Number of received packets with data overrun errors, since the port was last enabled.

swanDCEDrops.name: swanDCEDrops
swanDCEDrops.description: Number of instances when loss of DCE has been detected.

swanOutPacketType.name: swanOutPacketType
swanOutPacketType.description: The type of out going packet to generate on the HSSI link.

swanLinkErrorPercentage.name: swanLinkErrorPercentage
swanLinkErrorPercentage.description: The percentage of acceptible errors in hundreths of percent.

swanLinkErrorDuration.name: swanLinkErrorDuration
swanLinkErrorDuration.description: The time period in hundredths of a second over which the error percentage should be applied.

swanLinkErrorFailPeriods.name: swanLinkErrorFailPeriods
swanLinkErrorFailPeriods.description: The maximum number of periods allowed to contain the error percentage before the link quality is determined to have failed.

swanLinkErrorMaxPeriods.name: swanLinkErrorMaxPeriods
swanLinkErrorMaxPeriods.description: The maximum number of periods to be used for calculation of link quality. Default is 10.

swanLinkRestartTime.name: swanLinkRestartTime
swanLinkRestartTime.description: The time period in centiseconds which must contain error free LQR operation before restarting link.

swanPreserveFCS.name: swanPreserveFCS
swanPreserveFCS.description: Preserve received FCS if true, else regenerate FCS on packet transmission.

srepeaterTable.name: srepeaterTable
srepeaterTable.description: SMC-specific status information and control variables for a collection of repeater groups in a particular system.

srepeaterEntry.name: srepeaterEntry
srepeaterEntry.description: SMC-specific status information and control variables for a particular repeater domain (group) in the system.

srepeaterGroupID.name: srepeaterGroupID
srepeaterGroupID.description: The value of srepeaterGroupID is assigned so as to uniquely identify a repeater domain (group) in a system where a single agent manages multiple repeater domains.

srepeaterLinkStatusMask.name: srepeaterLinkStatusMask
srepeaterLinkStatusMask.description: This mask provides quick access to the general connectivity of the repeater. Each bit corresponds to the link status of a repeater port. If the bit is set to 1 then link pulses are being received, as per the IEEE specification. A bit value of zero indicates one of four conditions: - There is nothing physically attached to the port. - The port is not configured for twisted-pair. The AUI interface, for example, does not generate or test for link pulses. - The device attached to the port does not generate the link pulses specified by the IEEE standard. STARLAN devices, for example, do not generate such pulses. - The port is configured to ignore link pulses (see srepeaterPortLinkPulse). The least significant bit in the mask corresponds to repeater port 1; the high-order eight bits are always zero.

srepeaterExtendedStats.name: srepeaterExtendedStats
srepeaterExtendedStats.description: When enabled(1), the rptrMonitorGroup, rptrMonitorPort, and rptrAddrTrack tables are available, and the CEIOM maintains frame-by-frame tallies for the repeater in order to support these tables. Bridging performance may be slightly degraded due to the extra processing required, although the effect will not ordinarily be noticeable. When disabled(2), the rptrMonitorGroup, rptrMonitorPort, and rptrAddrTrack tables are not available.

srepeaterPortTable.name: srepeaterPortTable
srepeaterPortTable.description: SMC-specific status information and control variables for a collection of repeater ports in a particular system.

srepeaterPortEntry.name: srepeaterPortEntry
srepeaterPortEntry.description: SMC-specific status information and control variables for a particular repeater port in the system.

srepeaterPortGroupID.name: srepeaterPortGroupID
srepeaterPortGroupID.description: The value of srepeaterPortGroupID is assigned so as to uniquely identify a group (repeater ID) in a system where a single agent manages multiple repeater groups. This corresponds to ifIndex, as well as rptr...GroupIndex. As with the standard rptr MIB, this table treats a CEIOM, which is actually a complete repeater domain, as a repeater group.

srepeaterPortPortID.name: srepeaterPortPortID
srepeaterPortPortID.description: Identifies a repeater port within a repeater group/domain. Values correspond to physical connector position on the CEIOM. For the CEIOM-24, the leftmost position is port 1, the rightmost port 24.

srepeaterPortLinkPulse.name: srepeaterPortLinkPulse
srepeaterPortLinkPulse.description: When enabled (the default), the repeater port generates and expects to receive a link pulse, as per 10BaseT specification. When disabled, the port does not generate or expect link pulse, in order to accommodate pre-10BaseT twisted-pair Ethernet attachments.

sprotoTable.name: sprotoTable
sprotoTable.description: This table contains configuration information specifying the types of protocols used to bridge, route, translate, and filter frames for each port.

sprotoEntry.name: sprotoEntry
sprotoEntry.description: Each entry in this table specifies which protocols are used by a particular port in the ES/1.

sprotoIfIndex.name: sprotoIfIndex
sprotoIfIndex.description: Identifies the interface (port) to which this entry's information belongs. The value of this variable corresponds to ifIndex, as well as most of the other port identification values in related MIBs.

sprotoBridge.name: sprotoBridge
sprotoBridge.description: Defines the bridging method to be applied to frames received at, or destined for, this port. Ethernet and FDDI ports may be configured for transparent, srt, or none. Token Ring ports may be configured for any of the four options. The UART may only be configured to none.

sprotoSuppressBpdus.name: sprotoSuppressBpdus
sprotoSuppressBpdus.description: Allows transmission of spanning tree protocol packets to be suppressed. If normal(1), 802.1d spanning tree packets and source-routing spanning tree packets are transmitted as usual. If suppressed(2), these packets are not transmitted. This option may be needed for in- teroperability with non-802.1d spanning tree protocols (e.g., DEC LanBridge 100).

sprotoIpRoute.name: sprotoIpRoute
sprotoIpRoute.description: Specifies whether or not this port is to be used for IP routing.

sprotoIpxRoute.name: sprotoIpxRoute
sprotoIpxRoute.description: Specifies whether or not this port is to be used for Novell NetWare IPX routing.

sprotoAppleRoute.name: sprotoAppleRoute
sprotoAppleRoute.description: Specifies whether or not this port is to be used for AppleTalk (tm) routing.

sprotoArpTranslate.name: sprotoArpTranslate
sprotoArpTranslate.description: These options are intended to compensate for any like- ly implementation of internet ARP on 802.5 token ring. If set to bitswap1(2), then embedded MAC addresses for ARP packets with hardwareType 1 (Ethernet) will be bitswapped. If bitswap6(3) then embedded MAC addresses for ARP packets with hardware type 6 (IEEE 802) will be bitswapped. If bitswap61(4) then both type-1 and type-6 ARP packets will be bitswapped. If oneto6(5), then in- coming type-6 ARP packets will be changed to type-1 and outgoing type-1 ARP packets will be changed to type-6, both without bitswapping. If oneto6swap(6), then incom- ing type-6 ARP packets will be converted to type-1 and outgoing type-1 to type-6, with embedded addresses bitswapped. This option only applies to token ring ports. The fac- tory default for all ports is none(1).

sprotoArpSourceRoute.name: sprotoArpSourceRoute
sprotoArpSourceRoute.description: Specifies whether, when bridging TCP/IP ARP packets which are source-routing explorer frames, the routing information is to be stripped or propagated. If pass- Rif(1), the frame is bridged as is, with route- discovery proceeding as expected. If stripRif(2), then the routing information field is stripped before being propagated. This option allows non-source-routing (e.g., Ethernet) IP hosts to communicate tran- sparently. If passBoth(3), then both the original source-routed frame and the transparent equivalent are propagated. This choice provides maximum connectivity at some expense in network traffic. None(4) is identical to passRif. This option applies only to token ring ports.

sprotoIpxTranslate.name: sprotoIpxTranslate
sprotoIpxTranslate.description: Specifies whether, when bridging Novell IPX frames, they are to be translated to Ethernet-like frame for- mat. This option applies only to token ring ports.

sprotoAppleTranslate.name: sprotoAppleTranslate
sprotoAppleTranslate.description: Specifies whether, when bridging AppleTalk ELAP, TLAP, and AARP frames, those frames are to be translated between token ring and Ethernet format before being forwarded. This option applies only to token ring ports.

sprotoIbmLlcTranslate.name: sprotoIbmLlcTranslate
sprotoIbmLlcTranslate.description: Specifies whether, when bridging IBM LLC frames, an 8209-style translation between token ring and Ethernet format is to be performed before being forwarded. This option applies only to token ring ports.

sprotoRip.name: sprotoRip
sprotoRip.description: Specifies whether the internet Routing Information Protocol (RFC-1058) is to be used over this port. Only valid if sprotoIpRoute is enabled.

sprotoEgp.name: sprotoEgp
sprotoEgp.description: Specifies whether the internet External Gateway Proto- col (RFC-904) is to be used over this port. Only valid if sprotoIpRoute is enabled.

sprotoOspf.name: sprotoOspf
