sprotoOspf.description: Specifies whether the internet Open Shortest Path First protocol (RFC-1247) is to be used over this port. Only valid if sprotoIpRoute is enabled.

sprotoArpProxy.name: sprotoArpProxy
sprotoArpProxy.description: Specifies whether the port is to respond to internet ARP requests for which the unit is the next hop in a routed path. Only valid if sprotoIpRoute is enabled.

sprotoIbm8209Lsaps.name: sprotoIbm8209Lsaps
sprotoIbm8209Lsaps.description: Specifies up to eight LSAPs for which IBM 8209-style token-ring-to-Ethernet encapsulation is to be performed. Only valid if sprotoIbmLLcTranslate is enabled. This option applies only to token ring ports.

sprotoBootpRelay.name: sprotoBootpRelay
sprotoBootpRelay.description: Specifies whether or not this port is to relay BOOTP packets, as described in RFC-951 and subsequent internet-drafts. Only valid if IP routing is also enabled for this interface.

sprotoNetbiosTranslate.name: sprotoNetbiosTranslate
sprotoNetbiosTranslate.description: Specifies whether, when bridging Netbios packets which are source-routing explorer frames, the routing information is to be stripped or propagated. If pass- Rif(1), the frame is bridged as is, with route- discovery proceeding as expected. If stripRif(2), then the routing information field is stripped before being propagated. This option allows non-source-routing (e.g., Ethernet) Netbios hosts to communicate tran- sparently. If passBoth(3), then both the original source-routed frame and the transparent equivalent are propagated. This choice provides maximum connectivity at some expense in network traffic. None(4) is identical to passRif. This option applies only to token ring ports.

sprotoIpMulticast.name: sprotoIpMulticast
sprotoIpMulticast.description: Specifies whether the internet Multicast Routing Protocol (RFC-1075) is to be used over this port. Only valid if sprotoIpRoute is enabled.

sprotoTrunking.name: sprotoTrunking
sprotoTrunking.description: Specifies whether SMC's trunking protocol (an extension to the standard Spanning Tree) is to be used over this port.

sprotoIpxSrTranslate.name: sprotoIpxSrTranslate
sprotoIpxSrTranslate.description: Specifies whether, when bridging IPX packets which are source-routing explorer frames, the routing information is to be stripped or propagated. If pass- Rif(1), the frame is bridged as is, with route- discovery proceeding as expected. If stripRif(2), then the routing information field is stripped before being propagated. This option allows non-source-routing (e.g., Ethernet) IPX hosts to communicate tran- sparently. If passBoth(3), then both the original source-routed frame and the transparent equivalent are propagated. This choice provides maximum connectivity at some expense in network traffic. None(4) is identical to passRif. This option applies only to token ring ports.

sprotoAllTranslate.name: sprotoAllTranslate
sprotoAllTranslate.description: Specifies whether, when bridging any source-routed explorer frames, the routing information is to be stripped or propagated. If passRif(1), the frame is bridged as is, with route-discovery proceeding as expected. If stripRif(2), then the routing information field is stripped before being propagated. This option allows non-source-routing (e.g., Ethernet) IPX hosts to communicate tran- sparently. If passBoth(3), then both the original source-routed frame and the transparent equivalent are propagated. This choice provides maximum connectivity at some expense in network traffic. None(4) is identical to passRif. This option applies only to token ring ports.

sprotoSteHopCountAppliedRule.name: sprotoSteHopCountAppliedRule
sprotoSteHopCountAppliedRule.description: hopcountnotapplied(1), STE hop count rules are not applied to STE frames. Default for SR ports. Follows IBM's specifications. hopcountapplied(2), STE hop count rules are applied to STE frames. Default SRT ports. Follows IEEE specifications.

sprotoIpxDot3Framing.name: sprotoIpxDot3Framing
sprotoIpxDot3Framing.description: If sprotoIpxRoute or sprotoIpxTranslate is enabled, specifies the type of framing to be used for NetWare IPX packets on 802.3 networks. ethernet8023(1) speci- fies that the 802.3 header is to be used without an 802.2 header. ethernet2(2) specifies that Ethernet-2 framing is to be used, with etherType 8137. ether- net8022(3) specifies that an LLC header e0,e0,03 is to be used in conjunction with the 802.3 header.

sipxIfTable.name: sipxIfTable
sipxIfTable.description: Describes per-interface attributes of IPX routing.

sipxIfEntry.name: sipxIfEntry
sipxIfEntry.description: For a particular interface, defines the IPX routing information.

sipxIfIndex.name: sipxIfIndex
sipxIfIndex.description: Used to index through the interfaces (ports) on the ES/1, when used as an IPX router. Identical to ifIndex. Entries exist for all external interfaces, whether or not they are actually populated or configured for IPX routing.

sipxIfNetwork.name: sipxIfNetwork
sipxIfNetwork.description: The IPX network number associated with this interface.

sipxIfFraming.name: sipxIfFraming
sipxIfFraming.description: Defines the link-level framing to be used for this interface. Options 1-4 are available for Ethernet; options 3 and 4 are valid for token ring; options 3-5 are valid for FDDI links.

sipxIfInRipPkts.name: sipxIfInRipPkts
sipxIfInRipPkts.description: Number of IPX Routing Information Protocol packets received on this interface.

sipxIfOutRipPkts.name: sipxIfOutRipPkts
sipxIfOutRipPkts.description: Number of IPX Routing Information Protocol packets transmitted on this interface.

sipxIfInSapPkts.name: sipxIfInSapPkts
sipxIfInSapPkts.description: Number of IPX Service Advertising Protocol packets received on this interface.

sipxIfOutSapPkts.name: sipxIfOutSapPkts
sipxIfOutSapPkts.description: Number of IPX Service Advertising Protocol packets transmitted on this interface.

sipxRouteEntry.name: sipxRouteEntry
sipxRouteEntry.description: A route to a particular destination.

sipxRouteDest.name: sipxRouteDest
sipxRouteDest.description: The destination network address of this route.

sipxRouteIfIndex.name: sipxRouteIfIndex
sipxRouteIfIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the local interface through which the next hop of this route should be reached. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex.

sipxRouteTickCount.name: sipxRouteTickCount
sipxRouteTickCount.description: The primary routing metric for this route, which is an estimate of the number of 55 millisecond ticks that are needed to reach the destination.

sipxRouteHopCount.name: sipxRouteHopCount
sipxRouteHopCount.description: The secondary routing metric for this route, which is the number of routers that must be traversed to reach the destination.

sipxRouteNextHop.name: sipxRouteNextHop
sipxRouteNextHop.description: The IPX node address of the next hop of this route, if indirect. If direct, the address of the local interface.

sipxRouteAge.name: sipxRouteAge
sipxRouteAge.description: The number of seconds since this route was last updated.

sipxSapTable.name: sipxSapTable
sipxSapTable.description: This router's IPX service advertising cache table.

sipxSapEntry.name: sipxSapEntry
sipxSapEntry.description: An IPX service definition, as advertised by the SAP protocol and distributed through the SAP cache of this router.

sipxSapIndex.name: sipxSapIndex
sipxSapIndex.description: Used only as an artificial index to this table. Has no independent meaning.

sipxSapType.name: sipxSapType
sipxSapType.description: Identifies the type of service provided by the server. Values range 0..ffff, and are defined by Novell.

sipxSapNetwork.name: sipxSapNetwork
sipxSapNetwork.description: The IPX network address of the server providing the indicated service.

sipxSapNodeId.name: sipxSapNodeId
sipxSapNodeId.description: The IPX node address of the server. With NetWare 2.x, this corresponds to a physical MAC address, represented here in canonical (little-endian) bit order. With NetWare 3.x, it is typically 00:00:00:00:00:01.

sipxSapSocket.name: sipxSapSocket
sipxSapSocket.description: The socket number to which service requests should be addressed.

sipxSapHopCount.name: sipxSapHopCount
sipxSapHopCount.description: A count of the number of routers that must be traversed to reach this server.

sipxDiscardedRoutes.name: sipxDiscardedRoutes
sipxDiscardedRoutes.description: A count of the number of received routes that were lost due to insufficient resources.

sipxDiscardedServices.name: sipxDiscardedServices
sipxDiscardedServices.description: A count of the number of received SAP services that were lost due to insufficient resources.

sipxsfNextIndex.name: sipxsfNextIndex
sipxsfNextIndex.description: Next available filter index for adding filters. Starting with 1, in sequetianl ascending order.

sipxsfTable.name: sipxsfTable
sipxsfTable.description: This table defines the filtering criteria to be applied to Netware service advertisements. There can be no more than one filter per service name. Each filter is identified by a simple integer, which is more concise than the name if it were to be used as an index.

sipxsfEntry.name: sipxsfEntry
sipxsfEntry.description: Defines the filtering criteria to be applied to a particular service name.

sipxsfIndex.name: sipxsfIndex
sipxsfIndex.description: Assigned by the configurer to identify this filter. This index has no relationship to sipxSapIndex.

sipxsfSAPName.name: sipxsfSAPName
sipxsfSAPName.description: The service name. `*' can be used as wild card character which match all names.

sipxsfSAPType.name: sipxsfSAPType
sipxsfSAPType.description: The service type. Minus one or 65535 indicates all services of this name. Otherwise, the values are defined by Novell and other service providers (e.g., file server = 4).

sipxsfAccessMode.name: sipxsfAccessMode
sipxsfAccessMode.description: Permitted(1) allows the service name to be accepted or broadcasted. Denied(2) ignores the service name. Invalid(3) invalidates the filter entry.

sipxsfFilterType.name: sipxsfFilterType
sipxsfFilterType.description: If entry(1), filter is for the incoming named service. If exit(2), filter is for the outgoing named service.

sipxsfPortMap.name: sipxsfPortMap
sipxsfPortMap.description: A bit map defining port numbers to which the filter is applied. Octet 1 specifies port 1 to 8, octet 2 specifies port 9 to 16, and so on. Within each octet, the MSB maps to the lowerest port, and LSB maps to the highest port. For filters with FilterType entry(1), this parameter is ignored.

sipxsfNetworks.name: sipxsfNetworks
sipxsfNetworks.description: A list of network addresses to which the filter is applied. Each network address consists of 4 octets (i.e. a LONG word). For filter with FilterType entry(1), this parameter is ignored. Initial implementation also ignores this parameter.

sipxsfFiltered.name: sipxsfFiltered
sipxsfFiltered.description: Number of times the service has been filtered.

sipxsrAgingTime.name: sipxsrAgingTime
sipxsrAgingTime.description: IPX source route cache age time, in seconds.

sipxsrExplorerEntry.name: sipxsrExplorerEntry
sipxsrExplorerEntry.description: IPX SR explorer configuration for each port.

sipxsrStatus.name: sipxsrStatus
sipxsrStatus.description: valid(1) to configure explorer type; invalid(2) to remove explorer configuration and default to STE.

sipxsrExplorerType.name: sipxsrExplorerType
sipxsrExplorerType.description: use ARE or STE for explorer frame.

srtrdiscTable.name: srtrdiscTable
srtrdiscTable.description: This table contains configuration information controlling operation of the router discovery protocol (RFC-1256).

srtrdiscEntry.name: srtrdiscEntry
srtrdiscEntry.description: Each entry in this table configures the router discovery protocol for the particular interface.

srtrdiscIfIndex.name: srtrdiscIfIndex
srtrdiscIfIndex.description: Identifies the interface (port) to which this entry's information belongs. The value of this variable corresponds to ifIndex, as well as most of the other port identification values in related MIBs.

srtrdiscState.name: srtrdiscState
srtrdiscState.description: Specifies whether or not the router discovery protocol is in use for this interface. Defaults to disabled(2).

srtrdiscAdvertisementAddress.name: srtrdiscAdvertisementAddress
srtrdiscAdvertisementAddress.description: The IP address to be used for multicast router advertisements for this interface. If multicast(1), the all-systems multicast 224.0.0.1 is used. If broadcast, the limited-broadcast 255.255.255.255 is used.

srtrdiscAdvertisementInterval.name: srtrdiscAdvertisementInterval
srtrdiscAdvertisementInterval.description: The interval at which multicast router advertisements are to be transmitted, in seconds. Allowable values range between 4 and 1800.

srtrdiscLifetime.name: srtrdiscLifetime
srtrdiscLifetime.description: The value to be used for the Lifetime field of router advertisements. Values range from srtrdiscAdvertisementInterval to 9000.

srtrdiscPreference.name: srtrdiscPreference
srtrdiscPreference.description: The preferability of this interface's address as a default router, relative to other routers on the same subnet.

sipmRouteTable.name: sipmRouteTable
sipmRouteTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the origin routes that this router learns from neighboring routers and from initial installations of directly-connected routes. Origin is defined to be the subnetwork that can originate multicast packets.

sipmRouteEntry.name: sipmRouteEntry
sipmRouteEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) representing information on an origin route when IPM is enabled.

sipmRouteOrigin.name: sipmRouteOrigin
sipmRouteOrigin.description: The subnetwork address of the origin.

sipmRouteOriginMask.name: sipmRouteOriginMask
sipmRouteOriginMask.description: The subnetwork mask of the origin.

sipmRouteGateway.name: sipmRouteGateway
sipmRouteGateway.description: The next hop gateway toward the origin. This object has the value 0.0.0.0 for directly-connected routes.

sipmRouteMetric.name: sipmRouteMetric
sipmRouteMetric.description: The distance to this origin in number of hops.

sipmRouteAge.name: sipmRouteAge
sipmRouteAge.description: The time left for this origin route before aged out.

sipmRouteParents.name: sipmRouteParents
sipmRouteParents.description: The bitmapped incoming port(s) for which this origin is learned. This is an octet string of length 8. The least significant bit of the eighth octet is port 0. The least significant bit of the seventh octet is port 9 and so on up to a maximum of 64 ports.

sipmNeighborTable.name: sipmNeighborTable
sipmNeighborTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the neighboring routers on each interface port.

sipmNeighborEntry.name: sipmNeighborEntry
sipmNeighborEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) all neighbors which are learned from this local interface port.

sipmNeighborIfIndex.name: sipmNeighborIfIndex
sipmNeighborIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of the interface for which this entry contains information.

sipmNeighbors.name: sipmNeighbors
sipmNeighbors.description: The neighbor's IP address which was learned.

sipmNeighborLastHeard.name: sipmNeighborLastHeard
sipmNeighborLastHeard.description: The elapsed time since the neighbor was last heard.

sipmOutOfMemory.name: sipmOutOfMemory
sipmOutOfMemory.description: The number of times IP Multicast routines try to allocate memory for routes which failed.

sipmStatTable.name: sipmStatTable
sipmStatTable.description: The (conceptual) table containing multicast routing statistics for IP datagrams on a per port basis.

sipmStatEntry.name: sipmStatEntry
sipmStatEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) containing the multicast routing statistic for IP datagrams on a particular port.

sipmStatIfIndex.name: sipmStatIfIndex
sipmStatIfIndex.description: The interface port number on which corresponding IPM statistics gather.

sipmInBadPackets.name: sipmInBadPackets
sipmInBadPackets.description: The number of bad packets received which may include unknown DVMRP/IGMP messages, short packets, and checksum errors.

sipmCacheMiss.name: sipmCacheMiss
sipmCacheMiss.description: The number of times IP Multicast packets need to lookup a route at the IP layer for determining forwarding path.

sipcktTable.name: sipcktTable
sipcktTable.description: Defines attributes of IP circuits. A circuit is defined as a binding of a network number to a physical interface.

sipcktEntry.name: sipcktEntry
sipcktEntry.description: Defines the attributes of a binding of IP address and network to physical interface.

sipcktIndex.name: sipcktIndex
sipcktIndex.description: Identifies the physical interface. Identical to ifIndex.

sipcktIpAddress.name: sipcktIpAddress
sipcktIpAddress.description: Identifies the IP network that is bound to this interface.

sipcktNetMask.name: sipcktNetMask
sipcktNetMask.description: The subnet mask for the network associated with this address binding. If set to 0.0.0.0, will default to standard class A/B/C mask, depending on the value of sipcktIpAddress.

sipcktSourceRoute.name: sipcktSourceRoute
sipcktSourceRoute.description: Specifies the behavior of IP routing with respect to (link-layer) source routing for this circuit. If default(1) then behavior depends on whether the port is token ring or not. If token ring then ARP requests are sent both as source-routing explorers and as local frames; if not token ring then only local frames are sent. If sr(2) then ARP requests are sent as source-routing explorers only. If no-sr(3) then ARP requests are sent as local frames only. If both(4), ARP requests are sent both as source-routing explorers and as local frames. Default(1) should be adequate for most uses unless either source routing is being used on FDDI, or the ARP traffic is excessive on token ring.

sipNetToMediaTable.name: sipNetToMediaTable
sipNetToMediaTable.description: An extension to the standard ipNetToMedia table, containing other ARP cache attributes, specifically the current source route to the destination.

sipNetToMediaEntry.name: sipNetToMediaEntry
sipNetToMediaEntry.description: Each entry contains one IpAddress to `physical' address equivalence. Entries in this table exist even when there is no source route attached.

sipNetToMediaIfIndex.name: sipNetToMediaIfIndex
sipNetToMediaIfIndex.description: The interface on which this entry's equivalence is effective. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of ifIndex.

sipNetToMediaNetAddress.name: sipNetToMediaNetAddress
sipNetToMediaNetAddress.description: The IpAddress corresponding to the media- dependent `physical' address.

sipNetToMediaSourceRoute.name: sipNetToMediaSourceRoute
sipNetToMediaSourceRoute.description: The source route to this destination.

sipNetToMediaAge.name: sipNetToMediaAge
sipNetToMediaAge.description: The age, in seconds, of the entry to this destination.

profileEntry.name: profileEntry
profileEntry.description: There may be up to 16,368 entries. A profile consists of up to 16 entries, all with the same value for profileIndex. and there may be no more than 1,023 profiles. Entries are added by setting the profileType field to valid(1) - the variables with no defval clause will be automatically assigned a value based on the key. Entries are removed by setting the profileType field to invalid(2). Entries may not be modified other than by being added or removed completely.

profileIndex.name: profileIndex
profileIndex.description: A value from 1 to 1,023. All entries with the same profileIndex are part of the same profile.

profileSourceStart.name: profileSourceStart
profileSourceStart.description: Acceptable lowest value for the source port of a UDP or TCP packet.

profileSourceEnd.name: profileSourceEnd
profileSourceEnd.description: Acceptable highest value for the source port of a UDP or TCP packet.

profileDestStart.name: profileDestStart
profileDestStart.description: Acceptable lowest value for the destination port of a UDP or TCP packet.

profileDestEnd.name: profileDestEnd
profileDestEnd.description: Acceptable highest value for the destination port of a UDP or TCP packet.

ruleEntry.name: ruleEntry
ruleEntry.description: There may be up to 8,000 entries. Rules with 255.255.255.255 for both masks are accessed quickly; other rules are accessed less quickly. When adding a rule, at least one field must be specified, since there are defval clauses for most of the other fields (the fields without defval clauses will be obtained from the key itself).

ruleSourceIpMask.name: ruleSourceIpMask
ruleSourceIpMask.description: Mask to apply to the packet before comparing to ruleSourceIp.

ruleDestIpMask.name: ruleDestIpMask
ruleDestIpMask.description: Mask to apply to the packet before comparing to ruleSourceIp.

ruleUdpProfile.name: ruleUdpProfile
ruleUdpProfile.description: Which profile to use (i.e., the value of profileIndex) for UDP packets. A value of 0 means no profile, i.e., filter all packets. This rule only applies to packets with a fragment offset of zero.

ruleTcpProfile.name: ruleTcpProfile
ruleTcpProfile.description: Which profile to use (i.e., the value of profileIndex) for TCP packets for non-established sessions. A non-established session is indicated by neither the ACK nor RST bit being set in the TCP packet. A value of 0 means no profile, i.e., filter all packets. This rule only applies to packets with a fragment offset of zero.

ruleTcpEstProfile.name: ruleTcpEstProfile
ruleTcpEstProfile.description: Which profile to use (i.e., the value of profileIndex) for TCP packets for established sessions. An established session is indicated by the ACK or RST bit being set in the TCP packet. A value of 0 means no profile, i.e., filter all packets. This rule only applies to packets with a fragment offset of zero.

ruleFilterUdpFragment.name: ruleFilterUdpFragment
ruleFilterUdpFragment.description: Whether to filter UDP packets with a non-zero IP fragment offset.

ruleFilterTcpFragment.name: ruleFilterTcpFragment
ruleFilterTcpFragment.description: Whether to filter TCP packets with a non-zero IP fragment offset.

ruleFilterIpOption.name: ruleFilterIpOption
ruleFilterIpOption.description: Whether to filter packets with an IP header length of other than 5.

ruleAllowIcmp.name: ruleAllowIcmp
ruleAllowIcmp.description: Whether to forward ICMP packets (IP protocol 1).

ruleAllowIpWithinIp.name: ruleAllowIpWithinIp
ruleAllowIpWithinIp.description: Whether to forward IP encapsulated within IP packets (IP protocol 4).

ruleAllowEgp.name: ruleAllowEgp
ruleAllowEgp.description: Whether to forward EGP packets (IP protocol 8).

ruleAllowIgp.name: ruleAllowIgp
ruleAllowIgp.description: Whether to forward IGP packets (IP protocol 9).

ruleAllowIgrp.name: ruleAllowIgrp
ruleAllowIgrp.description: Whether to forward IGP packets (IP protocol 88).

ruleAllowOspf.name: ruleAllowOspf
ruleAllowOspf.description: Whether to forward OSPF packets (IP protocol 89).

ruleAllowAnyOther.name: ruleAllowAnyOther
ruleAllowAnyOther.description: Whether to forward all other types of IP packets (i.e., other than UDP, TCP, ICMP, IP encapsulated, EGP, IGP, IGRP, and OSPF).

spvcTable.name: spvcTable
spvcTable.description: This table maps pseudo-port indices to permanent virtual circuits.

spvcEntry.name: spvcEntry
spvcEntry.description: Each entry in this table describes one permanent virtual circuit.

spvcIfIndex.name: spvcIfIndex
spvcIfIndex.description: Identifies the virtual interface (port) on which this virtual circuit exists. The value of this variable corresponds to ifIndex, as well as most of the other port identification values in related MIBs.

spvcPathRX.name: spvcPathRX
spvcPathRX.description: Where virtual circuit identifiers are split into two parts, as in ATM, this is the most-significant part, and is identical to the ATM virtual path identifier.

spvcCircuitRX.name: spvcCircuitRX
spvcCircuitRX.description: Where virtual circuit identifiers are split into two parts, as in ATM, this is the least-significant part, and is identical to the ATM virtual circuit identifier.

spvcPathTX.name: spvcPathTX
spvcPathTX.description: Where virtual circuit identifiers are split into two parts, as in ATM, this is the most-significant part, and is identical to the ATM virtual path identifier.

spvcCircuitTX.name: spvcCircuitTX
spvcCircuitTX.description: Where virtual circuit identifiers are split into two parts, as in ATM, this is the least-significant part, and is identical to the ATM virtual circuit identifier.

spvcState.name: spvcState
spvcState.description: Controls the existence of this table entry.

spvcPhysPort.name: spvcPhysPort
spvcPhysPort.description: Identifies the physical interface (port) on which this virtual circuit exists. The value of this variable corresponds to ifIndex, as well as most of the other port identification values in related MIBs.

strunkTable.name: strunkTable
strunkTable.description: This table describes the trunking status and attributes of the interfaces that are configured for bridge trunking.

strunkEntry.name: strunkEntry
strunkEntry.description: An entry exists in this table for each physical interface (port) that is configured for trunking.

strunkIfIndex.name: strunkIfIndex
strunkIfIndex.description: Identifies a physical interface (port) which is configured for LAN trunking. The value of this variable corresponds to ifIndex, as well as most of the other port identification values in related MIBs.

strunkState.name: strunkState
strunkState.description: If off(1) then this link has not been enabled for trunking. If closed(2) then this link has not yet received any Trunking PDUs. If oneway(3) then incoming Trunking PDUs do not indicate that our PDUs are being successfully received by the far end. If joined(4) then this link is actively participating in the trunk group. If perturbed(5) then this link is actively participating in the trunk group; however, the transmission of data packets has been temporarily stopped due to a change in membership of the group. If helddown(6) then an error has been detected and the link is being held out-of-service until the error clears. If broken(7) then this link has been configured for trunking, but the port is physically non-operational.

strunkRemoteBridgeAddr.name: strunkRemoteBridgeAddr
strunkRemoteBridgeAddr.description: The MAC address portion of the bridge ID of the remote bridge.

strunkRemoteIp.name: strunkRemoteIp
strunkRemoteIp.description: The IP address of the remote bridge, as reported by that bridge for administrative purposes.

strunkLastError.name: strunkLastError
strunkLastError.description: The last reason for failure when the link is in closed, oneway, or helddown state.

strunkLinkOrdinal.name: strunkLinkOrdinal
strunkLinkOrdinal.description: The position of this link within the trunk group.

strunkLinkCount.name: strunkLinkCount
strunkLinkCount.description: The number of links within the trunk group.

strunkLastChange.name: strunkLastChange
strunkLastChange.description: The number of seconds since strunkState changed.

atextsysOperState.name: atextsysOperState
atextsysOperState.description: The operational state of AppleTalk routing.

atextportTable.name: atextportTable
atextportTable.description: A list of AppleTalk ports for this entity.

atextportEntry.name: atextportEntry
atextportEntry.description: The description of one of the AppleTalk ports on this entity.

atextportIndex.name: atextportIndex
atextportIndex.description: A unique value for each AppleTalk port. Its value is between 1 and the total number of AppleTalk ports. The value for each port must remain constant at least from the re-initialization of the entity's network management system to the next re-initialization.

atextportNetStart.name: atextportNetStart
atextportNetStart.description: The first AppleTalk network address in the configured range for this port. This is a two octet DDP network address in network byte order.

atextportNetEnd.name: atextportNetEnd
atextportNetEnd.description: The last AppleTalk network address in the configured range for this port. This is a two octet DDP network address in network byte order.

atextportNetAddress.name: atextportNetAddress
atextportNetAddress.description: The AppleTalk network address configured for this port.

atextportZone.name: atextportZone
atextportZone.description: The default zone name configured for this AppleTalk port.

atextportzipTable.name: atextportzipTable
atextportzipTable.description: The table of zone information configured for a port.

atextportzipEntry.name: atextportzipEntry
atextportzipEntry.description: An entry of zone information for a particular zone and port combination.

atextportZonePort.name: atextportZonePort
atextportZonePort.description: A unique value for each AppleTalk port.

atextportZoneIndex.name: atextportZoneIndex
atextportZoneIndex.description: An integer that is unique to the ZoneName that is present in this entry. For any given zone name, every Entry that has an equal zone name will have the same ZoneIndex.

atextportZoneName.name: atextportZoneName
atextportZoneName.description: The ASCII zone name of this entry.

slogFilter.name: slogFilter
slogFilter.description: The current event logging filter, represented as a bitmask.

slogTrap.name: slogTrap
slogTrap.description: When enabled, logging entries will cause SNMP traps to be generated.

slogOverwrite.name: slogOverwrite
slogOverwrite.description: When enabled, logging entries will be overwritten in the logging queue. When disabled, the entries in the logging queue will not be overwritten until someone reads them.

slogEntryNumber.name: slogEntryNumber
slogEntryNumber.description: The number of entries in the logging entry table.

slogEntryTable.name: slogEntryTable
slogEntryTable.description: This table contains the event logging entries.

slogIndex.name: slogIndex
slogIndex.description: The index of the logging entry in the logging entry table.

slogEntryTimeStamp.name: slogEntryTimeStamp
slogEntryTimeStamp.description: The time at which the event logging entry was generated.

slogEntryMessageText.name: slogEntryMessageText
slogEntryMessageText.description: The text of the eventlogging entry message.

slogEntryName.name: slogEntryName
slogEntryName.description: The name of the event logging entry.

strapControlTable.name: strapControlTable
strapControlTable.description: This table contains information about the severity of each trap and whether the trap is currently enabled.

strapEnabled.name: strapEnabled
strapEnabled.description: Enable or disable the generation of this trap.

strapSeverity.name: strapSeverity
strapSeverity.description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the trap.

strapSeverityControlTable.name: strapSeverityControlTable
strapSeverityControlTable.description: This table contains information about the whether a class of traps of a particular severity are enabled or disabled.

strapSeveritySeverity.name: strapSeveritySeverity
strapSeveritySeverity.description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the trap.

strapSeverityEnable.name: strapSeverityEnable
strapSeverityEnable.description: Enable or disable all traps of a given severity level.

strapIncludeText.name: strapIncludeText
strapIncludeText.description: Whether or not a formatted text string is included in the trap PDU.

strapTime.name: strapTime
strapTime.description: (This MIB variable replaces sysTrapTime). The time, in centiseconds, which should expire between the sending of traps.

strapRetry.name: strapRetry
strapRetry.description: The number of times any enterprise-specific trap is to be sent for a given event. PDUs are retried using a truncated exponential backoff: 2 seconds, 4 seconds, 8 seconds, 16 seconds, and then 32 seconds for all succeeding intervals.

strapEntryNumber.name: strapEntryNumber
strapEntryNumber.description: The number of traps that are in the strapTable.

strapTable.name: strapTable
strapTable.description: This table contains the latest traps that have been generated.

strapEntryIndex.name: strapEntryIndex
strapEntryIndex.description: A number representing the order in which the trap occurred in time. This 32 bit number can wrap.

strapEntryTimeStamp.name: strapEntryTimeStamp
strapEntryTimeStamp.description: The time at which the trap occurred.

strapNumber.name: strapNumber
strapNumber.description: The specific-trap number, as specified in the TRAP PDU.

strapEntrySeverity.name: strapEntrySeverity
strapEntrySeverity.description: A user-definable severity, indicating the importance of the trap.

smirrorStatus.name: smirrorStatus
smirrorStatus.description: invalid(1) to turn off port mirroring. local(2) to mirror either to a local port or to a remote ATX. remote(3) to mirror traffics from a remote ATX to a local port.

smirrorDiagPort.name: smirrorDiagPort
smirrorDiagPort.description: This entry defines the diagnostic port to output mirrored packets. It can be one of the Ethernet, Token Ring or FDDI interfaces in the ATX.

smirrorIPaddr.name: smirrorIPaddr
smirrorIPaddr.description: This entry defines the IP address for remote mirroring. It must be a valid host address.

smirrorTargetPortLists.name: smirrorTargetPortLists
smirrorTargetPortLists.description: An octet string specifies the list of ports to be mirrored, with each octet representing a single port number.

smirrorOversizePkt.name: smirrorOversizePkt
smirrorOversizePkt.description: Specified whether to discard or truncate oversized mirrored packets.

smirrorNotreadyDroppedPkts.name: smirrorNotreadyDroppedPkts
smirrorNotreadyDroppedPkts.description: Number of packets not mirrored either because the diagnostic port is not ready (local mirroring) or the tunnel to remote ATX is not ready (remote mirroring).

smirrorOversizeDroppedPkts.name: smirrorOversizeDroppedPkts
smirrorOversizeDroppedPkts.description: Number of oversized packets not mirrored.

smirrorCongestionDroppedPkts.name: smirrorCongestionDroppedPkts
smirrorCongestionDroppedPkts.description: Number of packets not mirrored due to exit port congestion.

smirrorNowrapperDroppedPkts.name: smirrorNowrapperDroppedPkts
smirrorNowrapperDroppedPkts.description: Number of packets not mirrored due to shortage of wrapper buffers (in mirroring frames to remote ATX).

smirrorRemoteStatus.name: smirrorRemoteStatus
smirrorRemoteStatus.description: Status when mirroring to remote ATX.

smirrorRemoteExitPort.name: smirrorRemoteExitPort
smirrorRemoteExitPort.description: Mirrored packets exit port number to remote ATX.

sWorkGroupNextNumber.name: sWorkGroupNextNumber
sWorkGroupNextNumber.description: The next available workgroup number to be used. When creating a new workgroup, it is recommended to read the value of the variable and use it to key into the workgroup table.

sWorkGroupCurrentCount.name: sWorkGroupCurrentCount
sWorkGroupCurrentCount.description: The total number of workgroups currently defined.

sWorkGroupMaxCount.name: sWorkGroupMaxCount
sWorkGroupMaxCount.description: The maximum number of workgroups allowed.

sWorkGroupTable.name: sWorkGroupTable
sWorkGroupTable.description: This table contains work group definitions for the interfaces.

sWorkGroupEntry.name: sWorkGroupEntry
sWorkGroupEntry.description: Each entry in this table contains a definition of a work group.

sWorkGroupNumber.name: sWorkGroupNumber
sWorkGroupNumber.description: An integer that identifies the work group, used as an index to this table.

sWorkGroupPorts.name: sWorkGroupPorts
sWorkGroupPorts.description: A list of all ports within the group. The first octet specified ports 1-8, the second 9-16, etc.

sWorkGroupType.name: sWorkGroupType
sWorkGroupType.description: The type of work group: all - no additional information needs to be supplied. ip - the IP network (and optionally, IP mask) must be supplied. ipx - the IPX network number may be supplied, or else all IPX network number will be assumed.

sWorkGroupIpMask.name: sWorkGroupIpMask
sWorkGroupIpMask.description: The IP network mask, if set to 0, the default network mask is applied.

sWorkGroupIpxNetwork.name: sWorkGroupIpxNetwork
sWorkGroupIpxNetwork.description: The IPX network number, 0 means all networks.

spingDataTimeout.name: spingDataTimeout
spingDataTimeout.description: The time, in centiseconds, from the last ping activity (a send or receive of an ECHO_RESPONSE or ECHO_REQUEST message), to when the spingEntry information for that ping request will be deleted.

spingTable.name: spingTable
spingTable.description: The set of information describing the active ping requests and their results.

spingEntry.name: spingEntry
spingEntry.description: The parameters, state and results of a ping request.

spingNMSAddr.name: spingNMSAddr
spingNMSAddr.description: The IP address of the NMS, used to determine which ping request to return information on.

spingDestAddr.name: spingDestAddr
spingDestAddr.description: The IP address which is to be the destination of the ping ECHO_REQUEST. This variable cannot be set while spingOperation is on.

spingState.name: spingState
spingState.description: The current state of the ping request.

spingCount.name: spingCount
spingCount.description: The number of ping requests which are to be sent. This variable cannot be set while spingOperation is on.

spingDataSize.name: spingDataSize
spingDataSize.description: The datagram packet size which will be sent with the ECHO_REQUEST, in bytes. This variable cannot be set while spingOperation is on.

spingWait.name: spingWait
spingWait.description: The time, in centiseconds, between the sending of each ECHO_REQUEST message. This variable cannot be set while spingOperation is on.

spingTimeout.name: spingTimeout
spingTimeout.description: The time, in centiseconds, since the last ECHO_RESPONSE was received (or the last ECHO_REQUEST was sent, if there have been no responses) when the ping request will time out. This variable cannot be set while spingOperation is on.

spingOperation.name: spingOperation
spingOperation.description: Setting spingOperation to on will begin the ping request. Setting spingOperation to off will terminate the ping request.

spingMin.name: spingMin
spingMin.description: The minimum round trip time for the ping requests and responses, in centiseconds.

spingMax.name: spingMax
spingMax.description: The maximum round trip for the ping requests and responses, in centiseconds.

spingAvg.name: spingAvg
spingAvg.description: The average round trip time for the ping requests and responses, in centiseconds.

spingNumTransmitted.name: spingNumTransmitted
spingNumTransmitted.description: The number of ICMP ECHO_REQUEST messages that have been transmitted during this ping request.

spingNumReceived.name: spingNumReceived
spingNumReceived.description: The number of ICMP ECHO_RESPONSE messages that have been received as a result of this ping request.

straceDataTimeout.name: straceDataTimeout
straceDataTimeout.description: The time, in centiseconds, from the last traceroute activity (the response to or timeout of the last probe sent), to when the straceEntry information for that traceroute request will be deleted.

straceTable.name: straceTable
straceTable.description: The set of information describing the active traceroute requests and their results.

straceEntry.name: straceEntry
straceEntry.description: The parameters, state, and results of a traceroute request.

straceNMSAddr.name: straceNMSAddr
straceNMSAddr.description: The IP address of the NMS, used to determine which traceroute request to return information on.

straceDestAddr.name: straceDestAddr
straceDestAddr.description: The IP address which is to be the destination of the traceroute request.This variable cannot be set while straceOperation is on.

straceMaxTTL.name: straceMaxTTL
straceMaxTTL.description: The maximum time-to-live for outgoing traceroute probe packets. This determines the number of hops that can be in a traceroute. This variable cannot be set while straceOperation is on.

straceDataSize.name: straceDataSize
straceDataSize.description: The size of the datagram sent with each probe. This variable cannot be set while straceOperation is on.

straceNumProbes.name: straceNumProbes
straceNumProbes.description: The number of probes which are sent for each hop. This variable cannot be set while straceOperation is on.

straceWait.name: straceWait
straceWait.description: The time to wait in response to a probe. This variable cannot be set while straceOperation is on.

straceOperation.name: straceOperation
straceOperation.description: Setting straceOperation to on will begin the traceroute request. Setting straceOperation to off will terminate the traceroute request.

straceHop.name: straceHop
straceHop.description: The hop count for a set of probes with a particular TTL.

straceHopAddress.name: straceHopAddress
straceHopAddress.description: The IP address of the host which responded for a probe with a particular TTL.

straceProbe.name: straceProbe
straceProbe.description: The probe instance for a particular hop.

straceState.name: straceState
straceState.description: The current state of the trace probe.

straceTime.name: straceTime
straceTime.description: Round trip time of a probe for a particular hop.

srtbProto.name: srtbProto
srtbProto.description: Bit mapped representation of srtb protocol configuration.

nbCacheIfIndex.name: nbCacheIfIndex
nbCacheIfIndex.description: This is the primary index into the Netbios Interface Table. It is the port number which you intend to enable/disable Netbios Caching.

nbCacheIfOperStatus.name: nbCacheIfOperStatus
nbCacheIfOperStatus.description: Indicates the operating state of netbios name caching for this port.
